Nursing.course_description: Medical sociology, sometimes referred to as health sociology, is the study of the ‘social’ causes and  consequences of health and illness, which play a critical role in determining or influencing the health of individuals, groups, and the larger society. This course will introduce students to central themes in medical sociology including the social determinants of health and disease, social behavior of patients and health care providers, social functions of health organizations and institutions, social patterns in the utilization of health services, and social policies toward health.
course_learning_outcomes: discuss and exemplify the main theories in the field of health sociology.
explain the basic research areas of sociology and the main debates about the sociology of health, which is a sub-branch of sociology.
Gain and express a critical perspective on the practices of health systems and institutions.
define the social determinants of health in access to health services.
apply sociological theory and concepts to their own health and illness experiences.

Nursing.course_description: This course provides an overview of nursing and nursing education. Criteria of professionalism, professional values and ethical principles are discussed. Professional nurse; provides information about their role as a member of the profession.
course_learning_outcomes: Can define the criteria of professionalism.
Can explain the importance of ethical principles and values for a profession.
Can express the roles and responsibilities of the nurse as a member of the interdisciplinary team.
Can define individual responsibilities in professional development.
Can explain the common characteristics of individuals who make a difference in different areas of the nursing profession.

Nursing.course_description: In this course, basic principles, processes, approaches and methods of psychology are discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: Define the basic concepts in psychology.
Explain psychological approaches.
Explain cognitive and psychosocial development processes.
Discuss the biological and psychological basis of behavior.
Use the knowledge and approaches learned in this course in patient care.
Explain sensation-perception-memory and learning processes.
Give meaning to human behavior.
Gain knowledge about approaches to human behavior.

Nursing.course_description: Learning the structure and normal functioning principles of the body, cells, tissues and organs in healthy individuals.
course_learning_outcomes: The students will be able to explain the human body on how the body response to a stimuli.
The students will be able to know explain various organs in the body function to maintain life.
The students will be able to explain the basis of understanding disease conditions.
List the physiological functions of various systems.
Describe the principles of regulation of function of the systems.
Apply the knowledge of human physiology to functional  situations
Apply the knowledge of human physiology to clinical situations
Explain normal function of the systems

Nursing.course_description: ELS 105 is for the students of Faculty of Health Sciences who did not attend English Preparatory Program. ELS 105 is an English course that aims to bring students to A1/ A1+ level. The students did not study prep program and do not have any English background. The grammar syllabus includes basic present verb tenses and provides a solid foundation to build on. Sounds of English will be introduced, and the vocabulary syllabus will focus on the most frequent words and phrases. Basic listening, reading, speaking and writing skills will also be gradually introduced in the course.
course_learning_outcomes: develop their language knowledge and experience starting from  zero to A1 Level.
read short, simple informative texts of ~150-300 words about people and places to get the general ideas and details.
listen to short and simple monologues and dialogues to understand short and simple instructions and directions and to get the basic personal information and descriptions
handle short and simple monologues, dialogues, questions and answers about basic greeting and introduction, familiar topics, personal information, daily routines and free time activities
write short, simple descriptions about people, places, and activities in ~100-150 words with appropriate vocabulary and language use.

Nursing.course_description:
The aim of this lecture is to teach any student who has finished its undergraduate studies, to acknowledge and learn the structure and the functionality of the Turkish language, from the perspective of linguistic and thought relation, to implement the skill to use the Turkish language right and effective as a written and spoken expression tool.
By teaching the historical process of the Turkish language, its place in the universal linguistic families, analyzing the important shifts and transformations of the Turkish language, and carefully teaching the sets of dictation, this lecture is set to transpose an overall knowledge and practical skill sets to students.
course_learning_outcomes: Understanding the fundamental concepts of the Turkish language, its historical process, and the ability to reflect these learnings in daily life.

Establishing the skill to understand the main takeaways of this course and further use these capacities to compare the Turkish language with other languages, detecting puzzles and issues within this comparison and address rational responses to such problems.

Learning the structural and conceptual aspects of the Turkish language, improving overall knowledge about the language for better evaluation and analysis, and to attain the ability to do accurate research and rational answers when being questioned about this field.

Learning the unique relationship of the language with other disciplines which will contribute greatly to the intellectual accumulation of the student(s) to use the language with awareness and originality.
To care about the oral and written set of rules of the Turkish language and raising awareness.

Nursing.course_description: In this course, the normal shape, structure, organs of the human body and the structural and functional relationships between these organs will be discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: List the concepts, definitions and terms of the anatomical structures of the body.
Describes the localization and features of the anatomical structures of the body.
Explain the structure and morphology of muscles, bones and joints.
Explains the structure of all body systems and the relationship between structure and function.
Establishes a cause-effect relationship between the functional relationships of body systems with each other.
Count the morphological features and functions of all organs that make up the body systems.
Defines important anatomical regions, structures and organs on the living body with their functions, knows the projection of the organs and shows their locations.
Use the basic knowledge of anatomy acquired to the field of health sciences education.

Nursing.course_description: This lecture provides to have basic knowledge of the structure of biomolecules that form the basic structure of the human body, cellular synthesis and functions, metabolism, biochemical analysis, sampling and general medical biochemistry which will be needed while performing the nursing and physical therapy and rehabilitation profession.
course_learning_outcomes: define basic biochemistry concepts and field of study.
comprehend the basic metabolic events in a healthy person and to establish the relations of these reactions with diseases.
understand and discuss the relationship between the biochemical mechanisms of diseases and the nursing and physical therapy and rehabilitation profession.

have basic knowledge about how and which biological samples can be taken to examine the metabolic parameters related with diseases and how they will be delivered to which laboratory and to apply this knowledge.
describe the anabolic and catabolic processes that affect human health and to explain the tests to be used in the diagnosis of diseases.
apply basic biochemistry concepts by evaluating the results of metabolic parameters related to diseases.

Nursing.course_description: Introduction to microbiology and its history, microorganisms in cellular structure (Prokaryotic and Eukaryotic), hospital infections and their control, the role of nurses in infection control, non-cellular microorganisms (Virus, Viroids, Prions), the characteristics of these microorganisms and the main diseases they cause. Control of in vitro growth of microorganisms (explaining their growth in a laboratory environment) and inhibition (sterilization and disinfection processes), control of in vivo growth of microorganisms (antimicrobial agents) will be covered.
course_learning_outcomes: Knows the concept of microorganisms and makes the classification of microorganisms.
Explain how microorganisms are produced in the laboratory environment and the methods used.
It can perform disinfection, sterilization and antisepsis processes, which are necessary methods to prevent the reproduction of microorganisms or to destroy them.
Count the use of antimicrobial agents and their mechanism of action.
Explain the sources of hospital infections, how they spread and how they can be prevented.

Nursing.course_description: Learning the structure and normal working principles of organs and systems in healthy individuals
course_learning_outcomes: Establishes a cause-effect relationship about how various systems work in order for the human body to maintain life
Analyzes the relationship of mechanisms underlying disease conditions with systems.
Infers when the organism will show deviations in relation to the systems.
Makes definitions about main physiology.
Explain the physiology of systems.
Defines the principles of organizing the functions of systems.
Analyse physiological responses & adaptation to environmental stresses

Nursing.course_description: ELS 106 is for the students of Faculty of Health Sciences who did not attend English Preparatory Program. ELS 106 is an English course that aims to bring students to A1+ /A2  level. The students must have taken ELS 105 as the prerequisite of this course. The grammar syllabus includes basic present, continuous and past verb tenses and provides a solid foundation to build on. Vocabulary syllabus will focus on the most frequent words and phrases. Basic listening, reading, speaking and writing skills will also be gradually introduced in the course.
course_learning_outcomes: develop their language knowledge and experience starting from  A1+  to A2 level in terms of present continuous tense, imperatives, can/can’t,  simple past and basic connectors
read simple descriptions, and short, simple informative texts of ~150-300 words about people and places to get the general ideas and details.
listen to short and simple monologues and dialogues to understand short and simple instructions and directions and to get the basic personal information and descriptions.
handle short and simple monologues, dialogues, questions and answers about familiar topics, daily routines and free time activities.
write short, simple descriptions about people, places, and activities in ~100-150 words with appropriate vocabulary and language use.

Nursing.course_description: The aim of this lecture is to teach any student who has finished its undergraduate studies, the Turkish language’s academic and literary verbalism features, reaching to a certain intellectual level that allows the student(s) to evaluate and discuss the teachings of such features, and learn the historical process of the literature that has been developed in this field.
course_learning_outcomes: Improving writing skills in Turkish language by learning the fundamental concepts and spelling rules.

Conceptualizing the written expressions in the Turkish language and acquiring the ability to understand the differences between the types of expression which will contribute to the skill set of the student(s).
Learning the basics of the written expressions, the ability to compare the written expression types and reflect this knowledge into personal work in the future.

Improving the ability of students who has finished their undergraduate studies to carry the knowledge in this class to professional and academic life, which will enable the individual to better itself in expressing, critical thinking and greatly distinguish itself in written command
Acquiring the ability of originality in thinking and demonstrating and analyzing the literary pieces with critical thinking abilities.

Nursing.course_description: This course covers the fundamentals of pharmacology, the interaction between medications and biological systems. The objective of this course is to provide students with a foundational understanding of pharmacology for their professional practice; to enable them to understand the fundamental mechanisms of action, side effects, routes of administration, and drug interactions of medications.
course_learning_outcomes: Define general concepts related to pharmacology.
Know drug delivery methods and drug administration methods.
Know pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetic phases of drug applications.
Know the basic elements of rational drug use.
Know the drugs effects on the systems and their basic mechanism of their effects.

Nursing.course_description: This course focuses on the use of basic nursing skills in meeting the health needs of the individual/family/society by using the ability to identify, analyze and problem-solve people's health problems. Although all nursing skills taught in this course are evidence-based, the skills taught in the course are; These include admission and discharge of the patient to the service, transfer of the patient, infection control, taking basic vital signs, self-care practices, evaluation of all patterns based on the Functional Health Pattern Model, invasive catheter applications, safe medication practices and other psychomotor skills.
course_learning_outcomes: Can explain basic human needs and accordingly the role and functions of the nurse in providing care to healthy/sick individuals.
Can describe the stages of the nursing process in analyzing the general health status of individuals and determining their needs.
Applies basic nursing skills in line with professional principles and standards and in an evidence-based manner.
Understands the importance of providing culturally based care to the individual, family and society.
Can explain professional ethical principles and values

Nursing.course_description: This course focuses on the evaluation of health, which is the first and most important step of the nursing process, providing subjective and objective data. In this course, subjective assessment will be provided by taking health information and health history based on Gordon's Functional Health Patterns Model, while objective assessment will be provided by physical examination. During the course, theoretical education and laboratory applications will proceed parallel to each other.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain the importance of biopsychosocial health assessment.
Determine nursing diagnoses based on subjective and objective data by using physical examination methods (palpation, inspection, percussion and auscultation) and Functional Health Patterns Model.
Distinguish and group the subjective and objective data obtained.
Create a suitable environment for data collection and apply interview principles
Distinguish and interpret abnormal findings in the evaluation of health.
Integrate the teachings of the course into clinical practice.

Nursing.course_description: This course is based on integrating and transferring the theoretical knowledge and laboratory studies taught within the scope of NHS 102 Nursing Fundamentals course into the real practice environment.
course_learning_outcomes: Can determine the care needs of the individual, family and community
Can apply evidence-based nursing care in line with the health needs of the individual, family and society.
Can apply basic nursing skills in line with professional principles and standards
Can work collaboratively with peers, colleagues, faculty and other healthcare professionals in the clinical setting
Can communicate effectively with peers, colleagues, faculty members, other health professionals, individuals they care for and their families in the clinical environment.

Nursing.course_description: HTR 111, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims teaching some terms like social science, history, revolution, counter-revolution, coups d’etat, state, political power, authority, law, rights etc. The module also aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman society, which is important to understand the conditions of Turkish Revolution. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To discuss some terms like "social science", "history", "revolution", "coups d'etat", "state", "political power", "authority", "law", "rights" etc.
To understand what the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman Empire was
To understand the differences between Ottoman land formation and feudalism.
To understand what Ottoman modernization was.
To discuss what Ottoman modernization was.

Nursing.course_description: In this course, self-awareness and behavior in interpersonal relationships, which are very important for students to provide qualified care to patients in their professional lives, will be discussed. It will also be discussed how students can use the basic principles and techniques of helpful communication in their personal and professional lives. In the course, the usage characteristics, similarities and differences of helpful communication principles and techniques in different age periods will be examined. Laboratory applications will be carried out to enable them to gain the skills to use all these subjects during field/clinical applications.
course_learning_outcomes: 1.Explains the importance of communication in individual and professional life.
2. Evaluates the impact of self-knowledge on communication with the individual, family and team.
3. Defines and distinguishes different behavioral characteristics used in interpersonal relationships.
4.Distinguishes therapeutic and non-therapeutic communication techniques and selects appropriate ones
5.Applies helpful communication principles and techniques effectively while working with individuals, families and groups of all age groups.
6. Evaluates communication skills from a critical perspective and determines strategies to improve them.

Nursing.course_description: This course is based on teaching theoretical knowledge about internal diseases associated with all body systems (definition of the disease, physiopathology, etiology, epidemiology, treatment methods and nursing process) and learning nursing care in which current and evidence-based practices are integrated to adult individuals diagnosed with internal diseases in different health care settings.
course_learning_outcomes: Defines the roles and responsibilities of internal medicine nurses serving in different care settings.
Explain the factors and disease processes that cause the formation and progression of internal diseases.
Explains the nursing models used in internal medicine nursing.
Evaluate individuals with a diagnosis of internal medicine from a biopsychosocial perspective and plays an active role in clinical decision-making processes.

Apply nursing care in line with teamwork dynamics and ethical and legal principles by using evidence-based practices and up-to-date guidelines in the treatment and care process of individuals with a diagnosis of internal diseases.
Integrate advances in technology and science into the internal medicine clinic and patient care.

Nursing.course_description: Definition of surgery, history of surgery, the effects of surgery on people and their families,  nursing care of surgical patients and their families.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain the definition and types of surgery
Explain the situations that require surgical intervention..
Explain common post-operative problems
Explain the individualized care needs of surgical patients in the perioperative period.
Provide care with systematic approach to individuals who have undergone surgery for different systems and organs before, during and after surgery..
Put into practice the basic skills they have learned while providing care.
Students will be able to provide postoperative nursing care.
Students will be able to apply a nursing care plan with a systematic approach before, during and after surgery.

Nursing.course_description: Basic concepts of surgical nursing, the importance and principles of surgical asepsis, planning, implementation and evaluation of patient care interventions before, during and after surgical intervention. Preparation of the nursing care plan. Planning, carrying out and evaluating pre/post surgical and discharge training for the patient and his family. Making case presentations according to daily life activities.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will be able to make nursing diagnose the surgical patient.
Explain the individualized care needs of surgical patients in the perioperative period.
Explain the physiological, psychological and social effects of anesthesia and surgical intervention on the individual.
Students will be able to provide preoperative nursing care.
Provide care with systematic approach to individuals who have undergone surgery for different systems and organs before, during and after surgery..
Students will be able to provide intraoperative nursing care.
Students will be able to provide postoperative nursing care.
Students will be able to put into practice the basic skills they have learned while providing care.

Nursing.course_description: The aim of this course is to enable the student to apply, use and develop the knowledge and skills learned in the NHS 201 Internal Medicine Nursing course in different clinical areas.
course_learning_outcomes: Evaluate the health status of individuals with needs related to internal health problems as a biopsychosocial whole, identify risks and priority health needs and take appropriate measures.
Analyze the biopsychosocial health risks of individuals who need internal health problems, current problems and nurses' responsibilities within the framework of legal and ethical regulations.
Develop and implement evidence-based nursing care plans for the individual's internal needs.
Provide trainings and health screenings to maintain and improve health in line with the needs of individuals with internal health problems.
Communicate and cooperate effectively with the individual, family and other team members.

Nursing.course_description: HTR 112, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the conditions of Turkish national war and Turkish revolution and foundation of Modern Turkish Republic. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To understand the reasons of the Turkish National War, to define the Turkish National War
To compare Sevres Treaty and Lozan Treaty.
To understand and define the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To understand political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To discuss political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.

Nursing.course_description: It is a course that includes health problems that women may encounter throughout their lives, reproductive health, pregnancy, birth and postpartum period, gynecological diseases, other factors affecting women's health and nursing care for these.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain the actions that can be taken to protect and improve women's health and the importance of reproductive health.
Provide evidence-based nursing care within the framework of ethical principles, laws and regulations during pregnancy, birth, postpartum period, gynecological diseases and menopause.
List the factors affecting fertility.
Explain sexually transmitted diseases and protection methods.
Provide education and consultancy for women's health.

Nursing.course_description: This course is based on the principle of providing students with the ability to think critically with different perspectives to enable in-depth and creative thinking in the situations they encounter in healthcare environments and events that require quick decision-making.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain the concept of critical thinking and the stages of critical thinking.
Explain strategies and practices for improving critical thinking skills.
Criticize the effects of clinical decision-making and critical thinking on patients, institutions, and employees in nursing practice.
Analyze and explain the problems they encounter in the work environment or a clinical case by gaining the ability to interpret events from various perspectives,
Develop critical reading skills and analyze critically with teamwork dynamics.

Nursing.course_description: This course is a course that allows students to apply and use the knowledge and skills they have acquired in NHS 301 Obstetric and Gynecology Nursing course in the clinic and develop relevant skills.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain basic concepts and definitions related to women's health and reproductive health.
Monitor patients in cases where women's health deteriorates and can identify deviations from normal.
Plans and implements nursing interventions for the care needs of women specific to all life periods in line with the nursing process based on evidence.
Determine the education needs of women according to all life periods.
Provide education and consultancy in line with the needs of women in all life periods.

Nursing.course_description: Today, as technology develops rapidly, healthcare services are one of the areas most affected by these developments. However, it is also known that technology is used very intensively in healthcare services. Within the scope of this course, all students participating in the course will be taught about the use of technology in healthcare, disruptive technologies, artificial intelligence, machine learning, blockchain, AR, VR, XR, mobile applications, wearable technologies, internet of things (IoT), telehealth, telemedicine, electronic health records. and will have basic knowledge of new technologies and applications such as big data, Robot Technologies and Robot Health workers. In addition, students will have basic knowledge and awareness about innovation and entrepreneurship in healthcare services. Students, who will theoretically have basic knowledge about technology, innovation and entrepreneurship, will prepare project proposals to implement their ideas in practice. With this course, students who have basic theoretical knowledge about technology will be able to implement their ideas on technology-based innovation and entrepreneurship with project proposals.
course_learning_outcomes: Can express/explain basic information about digital technologies and Artificial Intelligence in health services verbally/written.
Will be able to present the concepts and practices of disruptive technology in health services verbally/written.
Define digital technology and other related concepts covered in the course and explain the connections between them.
Define and discuss innovative thinking.
Can compare/explain the similarities and differences between the existing connections between the concepts of technology, innovation and entrepreneurship.
Students who will have the necessary equipment for technology-based projects can list/group the basic steps to bring their ideas to life with an innovative and entrepreneurial spirit.

Nursing.course_description: In this course: In line with universal child rights and professional nursing roles, the healthy growth and development of children between the ages of 0-18 in the family and society in terms of physical, cognitive, emotional and social aspects, protection from diseases and maximizing their health; Treatment, care and rehabilitation of the sick child when he becomes ill are discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: Define the roles and responsibilities of pediatric nurses in line with ethical principles in every field where child health services are provided.
Applies nursing care appropriate to the child's growth and development periods.
Distinguishes healthy and high-risk newborns.
Knows childhood vaccines.
Collects systematic data from children and families using functional health patterns.
Explains the differences between children and adults in terms of drug administration and vascular access.
Defines system diseases that affect all body functions of the child.
Manages the child's care process in emergencies and disasters.

Nursing.course_description: The past, present, and future of nursing are evaluated within the scope of health policies and in the content of the course, management and related concepts in nursing, organizational principles, health legislation, leadership in nursing, decision-making and problem-solving, conflict management, risk and crisis management, organization of patient care, manpower planning, quality management, teamwork, communication and motivation are covered. In addition, subjects related to global health problems and nursing management are analyzed with team-based learning methods, and strategies are developed using managerial tools and techniques in order to develop solution suggestions.
course_learning_outcomes: explain the organization and functioning of nursing services management.
analyze the legal responsibilities of nurses, legal regulations, and ethical principles related to nursing and their effects on nursing practice.
discuss the importance of leadership styles and management of nursing services in the delivery of effective, quality, and safe health care services.

analyze the impact of managerial skills such as problem-solving, teamwork, conflict management, communication, and leadership in providing and maintaining knowledge and technology-based healthcare services.
explain global health issues and challenges for nursing services and to propose solutions
use the patient classification/acuity system (PCAS) and nursing manpower planning.
present their managerial knowledge with creative techniques by developing their communication, cooperation, creativity and digital tool usage skills through teamwork.

Nursing.course_description: This course prepares the student for nursing research process: defining the problem, the research question/ developing the hypothesis, research design, data collection methods, writing a research report.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will be able to explain the roles and resposibilities of research in nursing.
Students will be able to describe the steps of research process
Students will be able to use the access ways of professional and scientific information
Students will be able to define resarch subject in nursing
Students will be able to develop the aims of a research
Students will be able to explain research design
Students will be able to explain population and sampling methods
Students will be able to explain data collection methods

Nursing.course_description: In line with universal child rights and professional nursing roles, the healthy growth and development of children between the ages of 0-18 in the family and society in terms of physical, cognitive, emotional and social aspects, protection from diseases and maximizing their health; Treatment, care and rehabilitation of the sick child when he becomes ill are discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: Can define the roles and responsibilities of the pediatric nurse in every field where child health services are provided.
Can use therapeutic communication techniques in the field of child health and disease nursing.
Can provide nursing care appropriate to the child's growth and development periods.
Can collect systematic data from the child and family using functional health patterns.
Plans, implements and evaluates nursing care for common health problems that affect all body functions of the child.

Nursing.course_description: The past, present and future of nursing are evaluated within the scope of health policies and in the content of the course, management and related concepts in nursing, health legislation, leadership in nursing, decision making and problem solving, conflict management, change management, risk and crisis management, power and authority in nursing, quality management, organizational principles and organizational behavior topics will be covered. In addition, group studies and workshops will be held on analyzing managerial problems encountered in nursing services and their solution methods.
course_learning_outcomes: explain the basic concepts of management and nursing management with the organization and functioning of nursing services.
use leadership and communication skills in the delivery of nursing services.
be aware of managerial problems in nursing services and use scientific problem solving approach in the analysis and solution of these managerial problems.
explain and analyze the importance of managerial skills such as quality management, communication management, conflict management and crisis management in the management of the health system.
discuss problem solving and decision making strategies.

Nursing.course_description: This course aims to teach students fundamental statistical concepts, descriptive and inferential statistics, parametric and non-parametric statistical methods, and their applications in health sciences research. Students will gain essential data collection, analysis, and interpretation skills by selecting appropriate statistical methods, conducting analyses under suitable conditions, and scientifically evaluating the results.
course_learning_outcomes: Formulate research questions and hypotheses in health sciences research articles.
Identify and define research variables and their measurement types.
Perform data entry, cleaning, and preprocessing in SPSS.
Select appropriate analysis methods based on research objectives and data characteristics.
Conduct descriptive and inferential statistical analyses using SPSS.
Compile results, present them in tables and graphs, and interpret them.

Nursing.course_description: In this course, the mental health service structure and the roles and responsibilities of the psychiatric nurse in providing primary, secondary and tertiary level mental health services are discussed. In this course, the symptoms, causes and treatments of major psychiatric disorders such as schizophrenia and other disorders with psychosis, bipolar disorders, depressive disorders, substance-related disorders and addiction disorders classified according to DSM-5 are examined in the biopsychosocial model. Protecting and improving mental health, including disaster management from a mental health perspective, and nursing interventions based on evidence and ethical principles for patients with acute and chronic psychiatric problems are discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: Define the roles and responsibilities of mental health and psychiatry nurses in every field of mental health service.
Analyze mental health service models.
Explain the biological, psychological and social factors, theories and treatment approaches that affect the cause and course of mental disorders.
Explain the effects of mental illnesses on the biopsychosocial life of individuals.

Explain the evidence-based biopsychosocial treatment approach and therapeutic nursing interventions for individuals with mental health problems within the framework of ethical principles and legal limits.

Nursing.course_description: In this course; Information will be given on the basic roles and responsibilities of the public health nurse for different segments of the society; while evaluating the preventive and improving health services of public health; It will be discussed about determining the health needs of the society, making the physical and social environment positive, and how the health care system will be handled within the scope of the individual, family, group and society. The organization of health services in Turkey, epidemiological approaches, home care, family health, school health, occupational health, environmental health, community mental health, prison and prison health, health of women, men, children, the elderly and the health of disadvantaged groups are focused on. will be handled with an approach.
course_learning_outcomes: define the basic concepts of public health, public health and the historical development of public health nursing, and the basic philosophy of public health nurses.
define the duties, authorities and responsibilities of the public health nurse regarding the primary health care services that should be provided to the individual/family/group/society.
fulfill public health nurse in all areas of life of the society,  their roles and responsibilities for the promotion and protection of health and public health problems.
explain and analyze the similarities and differences of models and theories used in all areas of public health nursing.
understand the need to cooperate with institutions in the society and establish correct and healthy communication.

Nursing.course_description: For students to learn by experiencing the scientific research planning process in the field of nursing and to internalize evidence-based practices; It is a course in which the student determines the research area through observation (lectures, clinical practices, scientific meetings attended, etc.) and prepares the definition and importance of the problem, research questions/hypotheses and the method section in full detail by scanning the literature in this determined area and presents it in written and oral form.
course_learning_outcomes: Can determine a research topic based on the literature.
Can write the text that will constitute the "Introduction and Aim" part of the graduation thesis, revealing the clinical importance of the research question.
Can write research question and/or hypothesis.

Can write the method section of the graduation thesis (research design, population, variables and measurements of variables, sample size, inclusion/exclusion criteria, measurement tools, data collection and statistical analysis, etc.).
Can write current literature information regarding the thesis topic.
The Ethics Committee may prepare an application form.
Can present the sections they had prepared regarding the thesis.

Nursing.course_description: This course enables the learner to use knowledge and skills obtained through NHS 401 course, and apply and improve those skills in real contexts of practice.
course_learning_outcomes: Can identify risks and priority health needs and take appropriate measures by assessing the health status of individuals with mental health disorders from a biopsychosocial perspective.
Analyze the biopsychosocial health risks and problems of individuals with mental health disorders in line with the legal and ethical boundaries of the nursing profession.
Develop and implement an evidence-based nursing care plan for the health needs of individuals with mental health disorders.
Can provide training to maintain and improve health for individuals with mental needs.
Cooperate with related parties and use effective communication skills while working as members of the mental health care team.

Nursing.course_description: This course enables the student to apply and use the knowledge and skills acquired in the NHS 403 Public Health Nursing course in a real environment and develop relevant skills.
course_learning_outcomes: explain the working areas of public health nurse.
discuss the duties and responsibilities of public health nurses in their fields of work.
recognize the characteristics of disadvantaged groups and define the health and nursing services to be given to these groups.

apply basic nursing skills such as evaluating the health status of the service recipients, providing training to the related individuals/family, general health examinations and health screenings related to the practice areas of the public health nurse.
cooperate and use effective communication skills while working as a member of the team he/she works with on the basis of public health nursing.

Nursing.course_description: This course focuses on the students gaining experience in nursing practices in line with their interests. It aims to develop and blend nursing roles such as leadership, research, decision-making, consultancy and management, which the student gained in previous terms, to practice nursing care and to prepare them for professional life.
course_learning_outcomes: Meet the holistic care needs of patients and their families using evidence-based information and technology.
Analyze the bio-psycho-social health risks of the individual and the family, current problems, and the responsibilities of the nurse within the framework of legal and ethical regulations.
Counseling and training in line with the bio-psychosocial care needs of the patient and family.
Applies the nursing process for the health needs of individuals and families.
Provide interdisciplinary cooperation using effective communication skills.

Nursing.course_description: It is a course in which students carry out the data collection process of their planned scientific research in the field of nursing within the scope of NHS 407 Graduation Thesis-I, analyze and report the obtained data, discuss and interpret the findings in line with the literature, and make suggestions based on the findings and present their work in written and oral form.
course_learning_outcomes: Can write all stages of the method section of the thesis.
Findings by tabulating the results obtained as a result of data analysis can write the section.
Can write the discussion section by interpreting the findings based on the literature.
Can write the conclusion and recommendations section based on the results of the thesis.
Can prepare the thesis in accordance with the "Thesis Writing Guide".
He/she can present his/her completed thesis.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This course provides general information about the dietitian profession from past to future, theoretical and applied nutrition and dietetics education, qualification standards for dietitians, and career preparation in the field of nutrition and dietetics.
course_learning_outcomes: define the profession of dietetics past to future.
learn the working areas of nutrition and dietetics profession.
learn the professional competencies required for nutrition and dietetics education.
learn the place of their profession among other professions.
know how to work in groups in their profession and will understand the importance of group work.
learn about new future study areas of their profession.
learn what a dietitian must have for a successful career.
learn for making the best portfolio in their professional career.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: An introductory course dealing with fundamentals and basic concepts of chemistry primarily designed for general college students, as well as those in specialized programs such as health sciences. The course covers general chemistry concepts such as atoms and molecules, periodic table trends and nomenclature, writing and balancing chemical equations, reaction stoichiometry, limiting reagent, and properties of gases. Laboratory experiments are designed to support the lecture topics.
course_learning_outcomes: Utilize the basic principles of chemistry such as properties of matter, chemical bonding, periodic table of elements, properties of atoms and molecules and the behavior of gases.
Describe many chemical concepts and use them as a foundation for further chemical knowledge.
Develop good laboratory skills and apply their knowledge of basic chemistry skills to other fields of physical sciences.
Collect, represent and interpret experimental results accurately and concisely using laboratory reports, graphs, and tables.
Describe and interpret the states of matter, the structure of the atom, arrangement of electrons and periodic table of elements.
Discuss, write or explain fundamental chemistry concepts

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This course involves introduction to human body structure, function, variation and evolution in cellular, tissue and organ level.
course_learning_outcomes: Describe the structure and functions of the human body at the level of cells, tissues and organs.
Explain the embryological development of the human body and metabolic system.
Describe the basic working principles and mechanism of the human body.
Explain the structure and function of the various human organ system including digestive, urinary, cardiovarcular, endocrine, respiratory, reproductive and nervous system
Describe the relationship between organ systems and their interactions in health and disease.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: In this course, basic principles, processes, approaches and methods of psychology are discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: Define the basic concepts in psychology.
Explain psychological approaches.
Explain cognitive and psychosocial development processes.
Discuss the biological and psychological basis of behavior.
Use the knowledge and approaches learned in this course in patient care.
Explain sensation-perception-memory and learning processes.
Give meaning to human behavior.
Gain knowledge about approaches to human behavior.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Learning the structure and normal functioning principles of the body, cells, tissues and organs in healthy individuals.
course_learning_outcomes: The students will be able to explain the human body on how the body response to a stimuli.
The students will be able to know explain various organs in the body function to maintain life.
The students will be able to explain the basis of understanding disease conditions.
List the physiological functions of various systems.
Describe the principles of regulation of function of the systems.
Apply the knowledge of human physiology to functional  situations
Apply the knowledge of human physiology to clinical situations
Explain normal function of the systems

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: ELS 105 is for the students of Faculty of Health Sciences who did not attend English Preparatory Program. ELS 105 is an English course that aims to bring students to A1/ A1+ level. The students did not study prep program and do not have any English background. The grammar syllabus includes basic present verb tenses and provides a solid foundation to build on. Sounds of English will be introduced, and the vocabulary syllabus will focus on the most frequent words and phrases. Basic listening, reading, speaking and writing skills will also be gradually introduced in the course.
course_learning_outcomes: develop their language knowledge and experience starting from  zero to A1 Level.
read short, simple informative texts of ~150-300 words about people and places to get the general ideas and details.
listen to short and simple monologues and dialogues to understand short and simple instructions and directions and to get the basic personal information and descriptions
handle short and simple monologues, dialogues, questions and answers about basic greeting and introduction, familiar topics, personal information, daily routines and free time activities
write short, simple descriptions about people, places, and activities in ~100-150 words with appropriate vocabulary and language use.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: HTR 111, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims teaching some terms like social science, history, revolution, counter-revolution, coups d’etat, state, political power, authority, law, rights etc. The module also aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman society, which is important to understand the conditions of Turkish Revolution. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To discuss some terms like "social science", "history", "revolution", "coups d'etat", "state", "political power", "authority", "law", "rights" etc.
To understand what the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman Empire was
To understand the differences between Ottoman land formation and feudalism.
To understand what Ottoman modernization was.
To discuss what Ottoman modernization was.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description:
The aim of this lecture is to teach any student who has finished its undergraduate studies, to acknowledge and learn the structure and the functionality of the Turkish language, from the perspective of linguistic and thought relation, to implement the skill to use the Turkish language right and effective as a written and spoken expression tool.
By teaching the historical process of the Turkish language, its place in the universal linguistic families, analyzing the important shifts and transformations of the Turkish language, and carefully teaching the sets of dictation, this lecture is set to transpose an overall knowledge and practical skill sets to students.
course_learning_outcomes: Understanding the fundamental concepts of the Turkish language, its historical process, and the ability to reflect these learnings in daily life.

Establishing the skill to understand the main takeaways of this course and further use these capacities to compare the Turkish language with other languages, detecting puzzles and issues within this comparison and address rational responses to such problems.

Learning the structural and conceptual aspects of the Turkish language, improving overall knowledge about the language for better evaluation and analysis, and to attain the ability to do accurate research and rational answers when being questioned about this field.

Learning the unique relationship of the language with other disciplines which will contribute greatly to the intellectual accumulation of the student(s) to use the language with awareness and originality.
To care about the oral and written set of rules of the Turkish language and raising awareness.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The course provides the ability to understand and use the unique language of health, which enables easier understanding of the disciplines in health. The aim of this course is to enable students to learn how these basic elements come together to form medical terms by introducing the roots, combining forms, prefixes and suffixes that make up medical terms. They will also learn medical terms and commonly used medical abbreviations from various branches.
course_learning_outcomes: know the basic building blocks of medical terms.
derive medical words by combining suffixes and roots.
pronounce medical terms.
know the meaning of medical terms.
list terms related to systems.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Today, as technology develops rapidly, healthcare services are one of the areas most affected by these developments. However, it is also known that technology is used very intensively in healthcare services. Within the scope of this course, all students participating in the course will be taught about the use of technology in healthcare, disruptive technologies, artificial intelligence, machine learning, blockchain, AR, VR, XR, mobile applications, wearable technologies, internet of things (IoT), telehealth, telemedicine, electronic health records. and will have basic knowledge of new technologies and applications such as big data, Robot Technologies and Robot Health workers. In addition, students will have basic knowledge and awareness about innovation and entrepreneurship in healthcare services. Students, who will theoretically have basic knowledge about technology, innovation and entrepreneurship, will prepare project proposals to implement their ideas in practice. With this course, students who have basic theoretical knowledge about technology will be able to implement their ideas on technology-based innovation and entrepreneurship with project proposals.
course_learning_outcomes: Can express/explain basic information about digital technologies and Artificial Intelligence in health services verbally/written.
Will be able to present the concepts and practices of disruptive technology in health services verbally/written.
Define digital technology and other related concepts covered in the course and explain the connections between them.
Define and discuss innovative thinking.
Can compare/explain the similarities and differences between the existing connections between the concepts of technology, innovation and entrepreneurship.
Students who will have the necessary equipment for technology-based projects can list/group the basic steps to bring their ideas to life with an innovative and entrepreneurial spirit.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The scope of this course includes the basic examination of food groups and nutrients at the basic level and learning the basic concepts of nutrition and dietetics.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will be able to define basic concepts related to nutrition, dietetics and food (nutrition, food, food groups, nutrition guidelines).
Students will have basic knowledge about reference values related to nutrients.
Students will learn the effect of nutrition on healthy life.
Students will learn the organisations that can provide reliable information about nutrition.
Students will analyse national level data on nutrition and health research.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: It provides a scientific basis to understand the function of carbon compounds, which are the basic building blocks of living systems, in the life process, and to learn the chemical behavior by examining the methods and reactions of this basis and the functional group, and to make structural analysis by evaluating the spectral data.
course_learning_outcomes: define basic organic chemistry concepts, name and classify organic compounds.
explain the analysis and synthesis of basic organic molecules.
formulate functional groups by explaining the physical and chemical properties of organic compounds.
decide which one can be dominant by determining basicity, acidity, nucleophilic and electrophilic properties in the structure of a compound.
interpret the structure and physical properties of organic molecules by analyzing the effects of these molecules on their biological properties.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Learning the structure and normal working principles of organs and systems in healthy individuals
course_learning_outcomes: Establishes a cause-effect relationship about how various systems work in order for the human body to maintain life
Analyzes the relationship of mechanisms underlying disease conditions with systems.
Infers when the organism will show deviations in relation to the systems.
Makes definitions about main physiology.
Explain the physiology of systems.
Defines the principles of organizing the functions of systems.
Analyse physiological responses & adaptation to environmental stresses

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: ELS 106 is for the students of Faculty of Health Sciences who did not attend English Preparatory Program. ELS 106 is an English course that aims to bring students to A1+ /A2  level. The students must have taken ELS 105 as the prerequisite of this course. The grammar syllabus includes basic present, continuous and past verb tenses and provides a solid foundation to build on. Vocabulary syllabus will focus on the most frequent words and phrases. Basic listening, reading, speaking and writing skills will also be gradually introduced in the course.
course_learning_outcomes: develop their language knowledge and experience starting from  A1+  to A2 level in terms of present continuous tense, imperatives, can/can’t,  simple past and basic connectors
read simple descriptions, and short, simple informative texts of ~150-300 words about people and places to get the general ideas and details.
listen to short and simple monologues and dialogues to understand short and simple instructions and directions and to get the basic personal information and descriptions.
handle short and simple monologues, dialogues, questions and answers about familiar topics, daily routines and free time activities.
write short, simple descriptions about people, places, and activities in ~100-150 words with appropriate vocabulary and language use.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: HTR 112, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the conditions of Turkish national war and Turkish revolution and foundation of Modern Turkish Republic. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To understand the reasons of the Turkish National War, to define the Turkish National War
To compare Sevres Treaty and Lozan Treaty.
To understand and define the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To understand political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To discuss political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The aim of this lecture is to teach any student who has finished its undergraduate studies, the Turkish language’s academic and literary verbalism features, reaching to a certain intellectual level that allows the student(s) to evaluate and discuss the teachings of such features, and learn the historical process of the literature that has been developed in this field.
course_learning_outcomes: Improving writing skills in Turkish language by learning the fundamental concepts and spelling rules.

Conceptualizing the written expressions in the Turkish language and acquiring the ability to understand the differences between the types of expression which will contribute to the skill set of the student(s).
Learning the basics of the written expressions, the ability to compare the written expression types and reflect this knowledge into personal work in the future.

Improving the ability of students who has finished their undergraduate studies to carry the knowledge in this class to professional and academic life, which will enable the individual to better itself in expressing, critical thinking and greatly distinguish itself in written command
Acquiring the ability of originality in thinking and demonstrating and analyzing the literary pieces with critical thinking abilities.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This lecture provides an introduction to biochemical molecules and pathways and their cellular context, synthesis of biological macromolecules and their components; conceptual basis for proteins and nucleic acids. Amino acids, peptides, proteins, enzymes, coenzymes, nucleic acids and protein biosynthesis, protein metabolism, citrate cycle, simple sugars, monosaccharides, fats, metabolism of fats, phospholipids, glycolipids, lipoproteins, hormones are involved in this lecture.
course_learning_outcomes: Describe the metabolic pathways, and the chemical constituents/nutrients they participate in.
Evaluate different macronutrient composition on metabolic pathways,describe  the  functions of  vitamins and minerals  as cofactors/ coenzymes  in metabolic pathways.
Compare the effects of various diseases on the alteration of metabolic pathways; discuss the effect of fed or fasting states on metabolic pathways.
Apply the basic and nutritional  biochemistry information when assessing the nutritional status of  individuals/groups and in nutrition care practices
Recognize how common foodstuffs are turned into metabolic energy and will able to predict the energy content and value of different classes of chemical compounds.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The content of this course includes; It includes general information about the nutritional components of foods, conveying information to consumers/consultants about the benefits and potential harmful points of food, chemical deterioration in foods, changes in microbial-physical and sensory quality losses, and measures to protect human health.
course_learning_outcomes: know chemical structure of carbohydrates, lipids and  proteins, explain their properties and roles in food systems
know the principles and applications of methods used in the analysis of food components (determination of protein, fat, moisture and inorganic matter).
discuss chemical, microbial or physical spoilage in foods.
methods and practices of creating consumer awareness among students and applying them to clients will be explained.
practice their basic knowledge of food chemistry in food processing and evaluate the concepts of smell, texture, color and general acceptance.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Principles of Nutrition course was designed to provide an integrated information on foods and nutrition basics.The first part of this course  provides information on the physiological functions and requirements of nutrients (macronutrients), and energy concepts which are the determinants of human health and diseases.  The second part of this course provides both theoretical and applied information on foods as the main sources of nutrients, from different perspectives (the structure of  foods, food  preperation methods, recent applications in food industry) which are the  determinants of  nutritional quality of diets
course_learning_outcomes: Students will be able to define and explain the sources, functions, digestion-absorption properties and requirements of macronutrients.
Students will be able to define the functions of macronutrients in food preparation and cooking.
Students will be able to observe the physical and chemical processes in the preparation and cooking of foods in the laboratory.
Students will be able to use some basic nutritional concepts such as body mass index, reference intake values of nutrients, energy requirement in dietetic practices.
Students will gain experience in food preparation and cooking by applying recipes in accordance with food preparation principles.
Students will be able to define key terms related to food preparation, cooking and production.
Students will be able to calculate the energy and macronutrient values ??of foods.
Students will learn practices related to improving nutritional quality.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The combination of lecture covers the pathogen microorganisms that are harmful to human health and cause food infections and the microorganisms that cause food spoilage and the probiotics which promote human health.
course_learning_outcomes: Distinguish between beneficial and harmful microorganisms and understand these microorganisms.
Learn about food preservation methods and understand how to prevent harmful microorganisms from developing in foods.
Learn about the principle of food safety from farm to fork and the systems used to ensure this.
Have detailed information about microorganisms called friendly microorganisms that are beneficial for human health.
Learn about food poisoning and food spoilage.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: In this course, the normal shape, structure, organs of the human body and the structural and functional relationships between these organs will be discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: List the concepts, definitions and terms of the anatomical structures of the body.
Describes the localization and features of the anatomical structures of the body.
Explain the structure and morphology of muscles, bones and joints.
Explains the structure of all body systems and the relationship between structure and function.
Establishes a cause-effect relationship between the functional relationships of body systems with each other.
Count the morphological features and functions of all organs that make up the body systems.
Defines important anatomical regions, structures and organs on the living body with their functions, knows the projection of the organs and shows their locations.
Use the basic knowledge of anatomy acquired to the field of health sciences education.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: For undergraduate students of the department of nutrition and dietetics about enzymes, red, white and fish meat, as well as nutritional elements and chemical changes in crustaceans and molluscs, eggs, flavoring substances, food additives, preservatives, colorants, cooking, various beverages, sources containing natural flavor substances. This course defines providing information at a level that will raise awareness.
course_learning_outcomes: Describe the structure and the composition of foods(fruits, vegetables, eggs, meat and meat products, milk and dairy products, cereals, coffe, tea and cacao).
Describe the processing and manufacturing of foods.
Explain  the functions of food constituents  in food processing and discuss the chemical reactions related with these compounds during processing and storage.
Critically synthesise and integrate relevant knowledge from the basic courses  of curriculum.
Apply basic knowledge on food processing  in practice settings of  food processing.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This lecture applies biochemistry to nutrient use from consumption through digestion, absorption, distribution and cellular metabolism. Carbohydrates, lipids, protein and amino acids metabolism, hormones and enzymes functions, nucleic acids as well as purine and prymidine metabolism, water and fat-soluble vitamins, vitamin like substances, minerals, electrolytes and water are involved into this lecture.
course_learning_outcomes: Describe the metabolic pathways and the chemical constituents/nutrients that participate in.
Establish the relations of metabolic reactions with diseases, by comprehending the basic metabolic events in a healthy person.
Discuss the effect of fed or fasting states on the metabolic pathways
Explain the functional foods in relation to health outcomes.
Define the molecular, cellular, biochemical, physiological and behavioral mechanisms that influence nutrient utilization, food intake and energy balance.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The Nutrition Principles and Practices II  is designed to provide fundamental and integrated knowledge on nutrition and food principles. Within this course, theoretical information is provided on the classification, physiological functions, and requirements of micronutrients that are essential for human health and disease prevention, accompanied by practical applications. The micronutrient content of foods, as well as nutrient losses occurring during preparation and cooking processes, are theoretically discussed and applied in a laboratory setting.
course_learning_outcomes: Understand the role of water and electrolytes in body functions and comprehend their importance on fluid balance and metabolism.
Learn the functions of minerals in metabolic processes in the human body and evaluate their critical role in nutrition.
Learn the role of fat-soluble vitamins in metabolism, their requirements and the effects of vitamin deficiency or toxicity on health.
Learn the role of water-soluble vitamins in metabolism, their requirements and the effects of vitamin deficiency or toxicity on health.
Evaluate the effects of vitamins and minerals on human health and analyze the relationship between these nutrients and diseases in the light of current scientific research.

Learn to calculate the micronutrient content of different food groups (milk and dairy products, meat and meat products, legumes, vegetables and fruits) and apply appropriate food preparation, cooking and storage methods to minimize micronutrient losses.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This lecture covers; the analysis and interpretation of the basic concepts of control and legislation related to food, food law which are in force, our legal regulations related to food in Turkey, Turkish Food Codex.
course_learning_outcomes: understand the law terminology and to evaluate legislation
learn the history of food legislation in our country
solve the problems with the help of food legislation
compare the  food regulations in our country and the other countries
have information about Turkish Food Codex

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This course provides general information about the definition, classification, etiology, nutritional treatment and current approaches of eating behaviors and disorders.
course_learning_outcomes: learn the definition and diagnostic criteria of eating behavior and disorders.
learn to evaluate the nutritional status of individuals with eating behavior and disorders.
learn up-to-date information about eating behavior and nutritional treatment of disorders.
explain eating behavior disorders and nutrition-related problems and develop solution suggestions.
know the comorbidities associated with eating behavior disorders and explain the complications.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description:
This lesson; Students of the department of nutrition and dietetics understand the importance of protective, preventive and developmental health services in terms of public health; It provides people with the knowledge and skills to increase awareness so that they can access the health services they need at home, at school and at work, at every stage of their lives, to encourage them to use the right health resources, to ensure the development of their health-related responsibilities, and to control the factors affecting health.
This course will make a significant contribution to students' success in identifying public health problems, basic approaches that are effective in protecting and improving health, and acquiring a holistic approach to solving these problems when they become professional.
course_learning_outcomes: learn about the historical development of public health and health-related policies.
identify risky groups in the society and organize health education programs to raise the health of the community to the next level.
have information about family health services.
define an emergency and explain its relationship with health.
define aging, community aging, health and social problems related to old age, and organization.
define risks related to occupational health and work life.
learn the epidemiology of chronic diseases and their effects on public health.
learn about the prevention and control of infectious diseases.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Within the scope of this course, it is aimed that students have theoretical and practical knowledge about anthropometric, biochemical and clinical findings and methods of food consumption used in the evaluation of nutritional status of individuals and societies.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will be able to explain the methods used in the evaluation of the nutritional status of the society and the individual.
Students will be able to discuss the role of nutritional status assessment in the nutritional care process, prevention and treatment of diseases.
Students will be able to discuss the importance of measuring diet in the evaluation of nutritional status and nutritional epidemiology and apply dietary measurement methods.
Students will gain the ability to measure anthropometric measurements accurately and will be able to demonstrate this by practice.
Students will be able to distinguish between nutritional status assessment and nutritional screening, define and apply nutritional screening tests for hospitalized patients.
Students will be able to describe and interpret biochemical tests used in the evaluation of nutritional status.
Students will be able to analyze, describe and discuss data on food consumption and clinical and biophysical tests used in the assessment of patient nutritional status.
Students will be able to plan and evaluate scientific research using the methods they have learned.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Collective nutrition and its importance, classification of collective nutrition systems, new production systems, management and organization are within the scope of this course. Classification of businesses providing all kinds of food and beverage services, management and organization of departments related to food and beverage in businesses, important rules regarding the acceptance of foods and raw materials, storage and production methods, food and beverage service methods are among the subjects of this course.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will be able to explain the system approach in food and beverage services.
Students will be able to explain the importance of food service operation systems in purchasing, storage and distribution and production.
Students will be able to refine an existing food service practice in purchasing, storage and distribution and production.
Students will be able to plan menus for food service institutions.
Students will gain the necessary equipment to develop management skills in food and beverage systems.
Students will learn food production methods in food and beverage services.
Students will learn the features required for planning the kitchen and dining hall in food service institutions.
Students will learn the practices of developing standard recipes in food service institutions.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Dietitians provide medical nutrition therapy for  prevention and management of nutrition related diseases .This course consist  nutrition related disease, the principals of medical nutrition therapy for nutrition related disease and the effects of medical nutrition on health.
course_learning_outcomes: At the end of this course, the student will be able to learn the principles of medical nutrition therapy.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to understand the symptoms and complications of diseases.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to learn the nutritional requirements of diseases.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to know the principles of medical nutrition therapy of diseases.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to make medical nutrition recommendations to patients.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to learn to evaluate the follow-up of the patient in the application of medical nutrition therapy in diseases.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to know how to apply medical nutrition therapy in diseases.
At the end of this course, the student will be able to apply medical nutrition therapy in diseases.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This course will enable students to explain the molecular mechanisms of the diseases covered in the Medical Nutrition Therapy course, to understand the physiopathology of diseases and associate them with nutritional treatment, to select parameters that may be useful in disease diagnosis, to make accurate inquiries for diagnosis, to follow the disease follow-up and its course, and to have general information about the medical treatments given.
course_learning_outcomes: understand the pathophysiology of energy balance, obesity, and eating disorders
learn the physiopathology of inflammatory diseases
learn the pathophysiology of endocrine system diseases and diabetes
understand the physiopathology of liver diseases
learn the pathophysiology of cardiovascular system diseases
learn the pathophysiology of metabolic diseases
learn the pathophysiology of brain-gut related diseases
learn the pathophysiology of cancer

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Pediatric nutrition has developed as an essential area of ??children's academic programs all over the world. This course provides nutrition rules for normal growth and the entire childhood period from prenatal to birth. This course also covers the importance of breastfeeding and newborn supplementary foods and formula feeding. . Provides information on pregnancy physiology and lactation problems and nutritional needs. This course provides information on childhood periods and nutritional needs.
course_learning_outcomes: have information about newborn, infant, preschool, school age and adolescent children.
learn the nutritional requirements of children according to their periods.
gain knowledge about breast milk and the importance of breast milk in feeding infants.
comprehend the newborn's complementary foods and formula feeding.
learn the importance of nutrition education and counseling in children.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The scope of this course includes storage processes in food and beverage services, a wide range of food preparation and cooking methods, service applications hygiene and sanitation, food safety management systems, accidents in food businesses and first aid, occupational health and safety practices.
course_learning_outcomes: Students will learn storage processes in food services.
Students will learn service processes in food services.
Students will learn hygiene / HACCP management and control in food services.
Students will gain cost control skills in food services.
Students will learn occupational health and safety practices in food services.
Students will evaluate waste prevention strategies in food services.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: Dietitians provide medical nutrition therapy for  prevention and management of nutrition related diseases .   This course consist  nutrition related disease, the principals of medical nutrition therapy for nutrition related disease and the effects of medical nutrition on health.
course_learning_outcomes: learn the principles of medical nutrition therapy application
understand the symptoms and complications of diseases
learn the nutritional and nutrient requirements in diseases
make medical nutrition recommendations to individuals diagnosed with diseases
learn to evaluate the patient's follow-up in medical nutrition therapy application in diseases
apply medical nutrition therapy in diseases

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The students will be able to explain the molecular mechanisms of the disease that studied Medical Nutrition Therapy course , be able to select the parameters that may be useful in the diagnosis of disease and will enable them to understand the pathophysiology of the disease associate with nutritional therapy.
course_learning_outcomes: Have knowledge about the basic physiology, functions, and diseases of the liver, bile ducts, and exocrine pancreas.
have knowledge about the pathophysiology of lower urinary tract diseases.
Have knowledge about the causes, clinical symptoms, and complications of acute and chronic kidney diseases.
Have knowledge about the pathophysiology of hematological system diseases.
Define the pathophysiology of Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and other cognitive degenerative diseases.
