Have knowledge about the pathophysiology of musculoskeletal system diseases.
Have knowledge about metabolic stress.
Explain the indications, contraindications, surgical processes, and immunosuppressive treatment approaches after organ transplantation in liver and kidney transplantation.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: In this course, significant public health nutrition problems and food/nutrition programs in the community  will be discussed. The topics of this course is the basis  of the community  dietitian applications.
course_learning_outcomes: The students will be understand the principles of nutritional epidemiology
The students will be able to discuss varıous nutritional practices in the community
The students will be able to discuss various nutrition problems in the community
The students will be able to use their course knowledge for problem solving and decision making
Students will be able to interpret how the knowledge gained in the course is applied in societies through scientific article reviews.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This course will provide theoretical and practical information about the treatment of diseases such as malabsorption, metabolic diseases, type I diabetes, malnutrition, gastroenteritis, nutritional deficiency diseases and very important research and resources in pediatric subjects. After this course, students will be able to plan diets in nutrition-related diseases in children.
course_learning_outcomes: have knowledge about childhood diseases.
will learn medical nutrition therapy in pediatric diseases.
apply the nutritional treatments they have learned about childhood diseases to sick children.
to calculate the nutritional requirements of children specific to their diseases and plan their nutrition program.
gain experience in nutritional counseling for sick children.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: This course describes the materials and methods used for nutrition counseling and education. The application of communication skills and strategies in nutrition counseling is taught in different groups.
course_learning_outcomes: The students will be able to learn the basic concepts of communication.
The students will be able to define the principles of individual and group education.
Students will be able to identify factors affecting food choices.
Students will be able to define the basic characteristics that nutrition consultants should have.
The students will be able to gain experience in communication skills and barriers
Students will be able to develop educational materials for different groups (children, elderly, pregnant, breastfeeding).
Students will experience the client follow-up process.

Nutrition and Dietetics.course_description: The seminar course is designed to prepare an effective visual presentation by combining the basic information on a special topic related to nutrition, foods or health with the results of current and reliable scientific studies, to present it orally in front of a community and to write a scientific review article. In this course, the principles of accessing and distinguishing reliable information, points to consider in scanning information from reliable websites, and preparing an effective presentation and compilation article are learned. In line with this information, students choose a topic related to nutrition, diet and health that they are interested in, do a detailed literature review on this subject, combine the information they have obtained from these sources with their basic knowledge by using their critical thinking skills, prepare an effective presentation and convey them verbally. They prepare scientific review articles related to the seminar topics.
course_learning_outcomes: The students will be able to learn how to determine whether a website is reliable
The students will be able to search  databases about nutrition and health effectively
The students will be able to distinguish valid nutrition information from misinformation on the net
The students will be able to integrate basic and current scientific knowledge with the information generated from observation, reasoning or experience  by analyzing synthesizing effectively

Information literacy skill group is included in this category for the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field. Information literacy skills include the competencies that a physiotherapist should possess while making use of up-to-date occupational technologies, as well as using online information, generating information and being involved in online learning processes. In this context, it includes using professional technologies, making use of accurate and reliable information sources appropriately, producing and disseminating information online, being present in social networks, online learning and effective use of information technologies for all these purposes. Within the scope of the PTR 144 course, our students gain the skills to distinguish reliable information sources and truth from unreliable and false ones, to distinguish the broadcasting companies and technology behind information sources, and to reach the competencies they need to access and benefit from the most accurate and reliable information in the student and lifelong learning processes.
course_learning_outcomes: To gain the necessary knowledge, skills and attitude to be a qualified professional in the field of health.
Learn the ethical principles that physiotherapists must follow.
To learn interprofessional approaches.
To learn communication methods in health sciences.
To use lifelong learning methods.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This lecture provides to have basic knowledge of the structure of biomolecules that form the basic structure of the human body, cellular synthesis and functions, metabolism, biochemical analysis, sampling and general medical biochemistry which will be needed while performing the nursing and physical therapy and rehabilitation profession.
course_learning_outcomes: define basic biochemistry concepts and field of study.
comprehend the basic metabolic events in a healthy person and to establish the relations of these reactions with diseases.
understand and discuss the relationship between the biochemical mechanisms of diseases and the nursing and physical therapy and rehabilitation profession.

have basic knowledge about how and which biological samples can be taken to examine the metabolic parameters related with diseases and how they will be delivered to which laboratory and to apply this knowledge.
describe the anabolic and catabolic processes that affect human health and to explain the tests to be used in the diagnosis of diseases.
apply basic biochemistry concepts by evaluating the results of metabolic parameters related to diseases.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: ELS 106 is for the students of Faculty of Health Sciences who did not attend English Preparatory Program. ELS 106 is an English course that aims to bring students to A1+ /A2  level. The students must have taken ELS 105 as the prerequisite of this course. The grammar syllabus includes basic present, continuous and past verb tenses and provides a solid foundation to build on. Vocabulary syllabus will focus on the most frequent words and phrases. Basic listening, reading, speaking and writing skills will also be gradually introduced in the course.
course_learning_outcomes: develop their language knowledge and experience starting from  A1+  to A2 level in terms of present continuous tense, imperatives, can/can’t,  simple past and basic connectors
read simple descriptions, and short, simple informative texts of ~150-300 words about people and places to get the general ideas and details.
listen to short and simple monologues and dialogues to understand short and simple instructions and directions and to get the basic personal information and descriptions.
handle short and simple monologues, dialogues, questions and answers about familiar topics, daily routines and free time activities.
write short, simple descriptions about people, places, and activities in ~100-150 words with appropriate vocabulary and language use.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: The aim of this lecture is to teach any student who has finished its undergraduate studies, the Turkish language’s academic and literary verbalism features, reaching to a certain intellectual level that allows the student(s) to evaluate and discuss the teachings of such features, and learn the historical process of the literature that has been developed in this field.
course_learning_outcomes: Improving writing skills in Turkish language by learning the fundamental concepts and spelling rules.

Conceptualizing the written expressions in the Turkish language and acquiring the ability to understand the differences between the types of expression which will contribute to the skill set of the student(s).
Learning the basics of the written expressions, the ability to compare the written expression types and reflect this knowledge into personal work in the future.

Improving the ability of students who has finished their undergraduate studies to carry the knowledge in this class to professional and academic life, which will enable the individual to better itself in expressing, critical thinking and greatly distinguish itself in written command
Acquiring the ability of originality in thinking and demonstrating and analyzing the literary pieces with critical thinking abilities.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: The history and basics of electrotherapy, Galvanic currents, Faradic currents/Sinusoidal currents, Diadynamic currents, Medium frequency currents, TENS, Russian currents, Micro currents, High Voltage currents, Magnetotherapy, Traction effect and related applications will be explained within the scope of these courses. Evidence-based electrotherapy features of this evidence will be discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: Know  the basic principles and procedures of  electrotherapy modalities.
Know the physiological and therapeutic effects of the different electrotherapy modalities and the application methods of these modalities.
Describe the indications, contraindications, dangers and precautions of the electrotherapy modalities.
Acquire the skill of application of the electrotherapy agents, for the purpose of treatment.
Plan the appropriate electrotheraphy programs.
Describe mechanism of  indications and contraindications of electrotherapy modalities in different illnesses.
Explain the effects of electrotherapy modalities on human body

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Exercise Physiology course includes the responses of the systems in the body in different exercise types, the changes in the responses in the systems due to environmental changes, and the evaluation of exercise capacity. Within the scope of this course, the responses in the musculoskeletal, nervous, cardiovascular, respiratory and endocrine systems during aerobic and anaerobic exercises are taught to the students. The skills to be acquired within the scope of practice courses are the application of exercise tests, the evaluation of functional capacity and the evaluation of vital signs during exercise and their interpretation according to normal values. In addition, determining an exercise program for sedentary and active individuals is another skill.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain how the body physiologically adapts to exercise or physical activity.
Describe the acute and chronic responses of the heart, circulatory and respiratory systems to exercise.
Explain the principles and basic concepts of anaerobic and aerobic exercise training.
Explain energy transfer in the body, energy expenditure during rest, physical activity and exercise.
Define the effects of personal and environmental factors on exercise.
Explain the basic physiological responses after exercise.
Measure acute and chronic responses to exercise, and assess functional exercise capacity.
Create exercise prescription and plan the program.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course covers planes and axes and movements of joints, correct posture, and alignment, posture analysis (front, back, and side), muscle length and flexibility tests, anthropometry measurements, circumference and diameter measurements of extremities, head, trunk, and extremity length measurements, and goniometric measurements of joints, manual muscle testing of body muscles, which is one of the most important and basic techniques used in physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
course_learning_outcomes: Understand and describe correct posture and asses the posture and identify postural problems.
Apply muscle shortness-flexibility tests  and find out the problems and will be able to apply antropometric measurements, circumferential and diametric measurements.
Perform joint range of motion analysis by goniometric measurements. and define limitations, be aware of the rules to follow while performing these assesments.
Standardize manual muscle test procedures, perform it, identify modification needs, compare the results and define muscle weakness and rehabilitation needs.
Define neck and trunk muscles, their functions, nerve innervations and segments and how to apply manuel muscle testing on them.
Define upper and lower extremity muscles,their functions,innervations and segments and applying manuel muscle testing on them.
Define fascial muscles, their functions, nerve innervations and segments and how to apply manuel muscle testing on them.
Performs the management of the appropriate measurement and evaluation methods for individuals with different health problems or healthy.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: The aim of this course is to introduce students to the definition of kinesiology and kinematics, bone and joint kinematics, skeletal-muscle interaction, basic structure, function and composition of joints, structure, types, function and mechanics of function of muscles, kinetic chains, bone structure, types and composition, on bone stresses, structure, properties, kinetics of cartilage tissue, properties of collagen tissue, kinetics, general mechanical principles, movement and movement types, balance, orientation planes and coordinates, trunk (head-neck, trunk) kinetics, upper extremity (shoulder) -arm, elbow, hand-wrist) kinetics, lower extremity (pelvis, hip, knee, foot-ankle) kinetics, columna vertebralis kinetics, spinal plane problems (scoliosis, kyphosis, lordosis, etc.), about normal and pathological gait issues.
course_learning_outcomes: Define kinesiology, kinetics, and kinematics.
Define the structures and functions of muscle, bone, joint, cartilage and collagen tissues.
Define general mechanics principles, motion and motion types, balance, orientation planes, and coordinates.
Explain the trunk (temporomandibular joint, head-neck, trunk) and columna vertabralis kinesiology.
Explain the upper extremity and lower extremity kinesiology.
Define normal and pathological gait analysis.
Perform kinematic analysis of motion in active and stable positions.
Use biomechanical and kinesiological principles while assessing a person, planning an exercise or modifying an exercise.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course covers growth and development, terminology and development theories, neural development of the central nervous system, brain and plasticity, definition of healthy newborn, first examination of newborn, normal development process of child from prenatal to adolescence, cognitive motor development of human, premature baby, birth trauma, Congenital deformations, diseases of the newborn, examination of the late-born child, evaluation of the effects of aging on the body and quality of life, aims and results of rehabilitation in the aging process from birth to old age, aims and results of rehabilitation in old age.
course_learning_outcomes: Identify all processes of the life stages which are different from each other from birth to death.
Understand the process of growth and development and importance of keeping these processes in a healthy way.

Distinguish the normal and abnormal patterns and reflexes seen in the growth and development process of the infant, the milestones of human developmental stages and physiological developmental periodical expectations.
Describe normal growth and development expectations,abnormalities and rehabilitation needs of toddler, pre-school, school age, adolescent, adult and elderly stages of life.
Define neural plasticity concept and  understand interactions and changes of neural mechanisms throughout the growth an development process.
Describe motor skill development throughout the life span.
Identify the progression of normal gross and fine motor development throughout the life span.
Discuss the influence of wellness activities on motor skill abilities throughout the life span.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: HTR 111, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims teaching some terms like social science, history, revolution, counter-revolution, coups d’etat, state, political power, authority, law, rights etc. The module also aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman society, which is important to understand the conditions of Turkish Revolution. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To discuss some terms like "social science", "history", "revolution", "coups d'etat", "state", "political power", "authority", "law", "rights" etc.
To understand what the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman Empire was
To understand the differences between Ottoman land formation and feudalism.
To understand what Ottoman modernization was.
To discuss what Ottoman modernization was.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
An introduction to research in the evidence-based physiotherapy practice including the Scientific Method, library and multimedia resources, research process,  research designs, experimental design principles, research ethics, critical review and analysis of research publications, statistical concepts, and writing of a research report and research proposal. 

Description of basing principles related to evidence-based practice in physiotherapy, comprehension of the best scientific evidence and development the skills for applying them.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of learning skills basically defines the competencies that a physiotherapist should have in order to adapt to the work environment in which he will work after graduation and to contribute to the development of this environment. For the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field, there are four skill groups in this category as cooperation, creativity, problem solving and communication. Problem solving skills include the reasoning competencies that a physiotherapist should use when producing solutions/methods on professional cases or problems, especially clinical problems, while applying and improving this solution/method. In this direction, it focuses on developing problem solving, critical thinking and reflective thinking (reflective reasoning) skills. Within the scope of PTR 201, our students can learn to identify complex problems that arise in clinical settings, to reason about the causes and consequences of problems, to develop hypotheses for evidence-based solutions, to question the suitability of hypotheses, to apply them and to reason about the results they can achieve.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of literacy skills, in its simplest form, is a physiotherapist's ability to distinguish reliable information sources and truth from unreliable and false ones, to distinguish the broadcasting companies and technology behind information sources, and to access and benefit from the most accurate and reliable information with this perspective. defines the required competencies. Information literacy skill group is included in this category for the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field. Information literacy skills include the competencies that a physiotherapist should possess while making use of up-to-date occupational technologies, as well as using online information, generating information and being involved in online learning processes. In this context, it includes using professional technologies, making use of accurate and reliable information sources appropriately, producing and disseminating information online, being present in social networks, online learning and effective use of information technologies for all these purposes. Within the scope of the PTR 201 course, our students gain the skills to distinguish reliable information sources and truth from unreliable and false ones, to distinguish the broadcasting companies and technology behind the information sources, and to reach the competencies they need to access and benefit from the most accurate and reliable information in the student and lifelong learning processes.

Within the scope of PTR 201 course, it contributes to our students on the importance of adapting to innovations in daily and business life, the importance of generating new and different ideas, analyzing health environments, having information about project development and application processes, and developing innovative ideas about their field.
course_learning_outcomes: To use appropriate terminology for describing and classifying study  variables and outcome measures.
To understand and interpret the metric properties and practical principles of measurements used in both clinical and research contexts.
To identify common obstacles that may be encountered in the application and application of knowledge in clinical samples on the basis of the obtained knowledge.
To understand and apply the basic principles and processes of research ethics.
To define systemic screening methods and steps.
To make a critical evaluation of research articles.
To formulate a summary of evaluation findings.
To interpret the main findings of systemic screening.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course gives information about innovative approaches related physiotherapy and rehabilitation, which mechanism can affect and how much opportunity. In what way and for what purpose do they use the power of the new technologies of the age. It offers knowledge of the scope of technology-based systems and what innovations and what good it is from human services to material and physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
course_learning_outcomes: Understand the role of the physiotherapist profession in the historical development and the importance of the concept of creative thinking in future.
Define the ways of providing rehabilitation related services through initiatives that may be advantageous in terms of time and place.
Explain the integrated ways of technologies using virtual reality to different and specific fields of rehabilitation.
Define the role and importance of technology in improving rehabilitation, and the similar aspects of rehabilitation and technology.
Distinguish the advantages and disadvantages of technology-based rehabilitation interventions.
Interpret the effects of science, technology and innovation in terms of individual rehabilitation and treatment satisfaction from an ethical perspective.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Manipulation is the use of the hands in patient management process using instructions and maneuvers to maintain maximal, painless movement of the musculoskleteal system in postural balance. This course aims to learn and practice physiological objectives of palpation and basic manipulative treatment techniques used in physiotherapy regarding anatomic and physiologic backgrounds and aspects.In this course the principles and theory of manipulation and mobilization techniques, positioning, indications and contraindications are explained.
course_learning_outcomes: explain the diagnostic and therapeutic value of palpation and manipulation in physiotherapy, can define the types and principles of manipulation and massage techniques.
apply classical massage techniques based on anatomical and physiological knowledge.
explain regional applications used in physiotherapy clinics and sports medicine.
explain and apply connective tissue massage.
explain the theory and basic principles of manipulation and mobilization techniques.
explain the application indications and contraindications of manipulation and mobilization techniques.
explain evidence-based theories supporting the use of manual therapy applications.
apply the necessary practices for applying manipulation and mobilization techniques.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: In this course, joint range of motion exercises, stretching and mobility exercises, strengthening exercises (isometrics, progressive resistance exercises, theraband exercises, isotonic weight training) exercises, isokinetic exercises, relaxation exercises, closed kinetic chain exercises, balance, coordination and deep sensory exercises, plyometric exercises, dynamic lumbar stabilization exercises, special exercises such as Mckenzie, Williams, Codman, Wand are discussed. Factors to be considered while designing an appropriate treatment program and prescribing exercise are emphasized. The most appropriate therapeutic exercise approaches for the client/patient are handled by considering the biopsychosocial model by determining long and short treatment goals.
course_learning_outcomes: To define the types and features of therapeutic and preventive exercises.
To understand diseases and health conditions for which therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches are appropriate.
To prepare exercise prescriptions specific to health and disease conditions by associating therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches with the evaluation results.
To understand how therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches should be applied and what should be considered.
To determine the necessary modifications by following the programs prepared for therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches.
To gain basic skills and knowledge that can diversify therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches.
To plan and apply therapeutic and preventive exercises in accordance with the biopsychosocial model.
To interpret the literature by following the innovations related to therapeutic and preventive exercise.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Today, as technology develops rapidly, healthcare services are one of the areas most affected by these developments. However, it is also known that technology is used very intensively in healthcare services. Within the scope of this course, all students participating in the course will be taught about the use of technology in healthcare, disruptive technologies, artificial intelligence, machine learning, blockchain, AR, VR, XR, mobile applications, wearable technologies, internet of things (IoT), telehealth, telemedicine, electronic health records. and will have basic knowledge of new technologies and applications such as big data, Robot Technologies and Robot Health workers. In addition, students will have basic knowledge and awareness about innovation and entrepreneurship in healthcare services. Students, who will theoretically have basic knowledge about technology, innovation and entrepreneurship, will prepare project proposals to implement their ideas in practice. With this course, students who have basic theoretical knowledge about technology will be able to implement their ideas on technology-based innovation and entrepreneurship with project proposals.
course_learning_outcomes: Can express/explain basic information about digital technologies and Artificial Intelligence in health services verbally/written.
Will be able to present the concepts and practices of disruptive technology in health services verbally/written.
Define digital technology and other related concepts covered in the course and explain the connections between them.
Define and discuss innovative thinking.
Can compare/explain the similarities and differences between the existing connections between the concepts of technology, innovation and entrepreneurship.
Students who will have the necessary equipment for technology-based projects can list/group the basic steps to bring their ideas to life with an innovative and entrepreneurial spirit.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: HTR 112, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the conditions of Turkish national war and Turkish revolution and foundation of Modern Turkish Republic. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To understand the reasons of the Turkish National War, to define the Turkish National War
To compare Sevres Treaty and Lozan Treaty.
To understand and define the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To understand political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To discuss political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course an applied course. In this course, following the learning of basic Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation applications (Measurement and Evaluation in Physiotherapy, Heat, Light and Hydrotherapy, Electrotherapy, Manipulation and Mobilization Techniques), it is aimed to develop their clinical application plans and experiences. In the course, the student's case reports will be examined and case discussions will be held within the framework of the topics to be covered in modules.
course_learning_outcomes: To develop professional behavior regarding the roles and responsibilities of physiotherapists in the areas where physiotherapy and rehabilitation services are provided.
To make and define physiotherapy and rehabilitation evaluations.
To explain the evidence-based treatment plans and interventions for the treatment of the patients.
To search different diseases and symptoms in clinical practice and to discuss the mechanism of methods and techniques used in physiotherapy.
To make clinical decisions, explain complications, using theoretical and practical knowledge.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: It includes general introduction to physiotherapy methods applied within the scope of neurodevelopmental therapy, theoretical and practical information of Bruunstrom, Bobath and Johnstone approaches.
course_learning_outcomes: To learn theoretical principles and practical application of Bruunstrom, Bobath and  Johnstone concepts.
To learn assessment principles of Bruunstrom, Johnstone and Bobath  approaches and to comparison of treatment approaches on cases
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Bruunstrom concept and learn upper and lower extremity exercises of Bruunstrom Concept.
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Bobath concept and learn upper and lower extremity exercises of Bobath Concept.
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Johnstone concept and learn upper and lower extremity exercises of Johnstone Concept.
To evaluate and analyze neurological cases.
To plan the physiotherapy rehabilitation program of neurological cases.
To compare the treatment programs of neurological cases

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
This course covers the approaches in orthopaedic problems and the early and late rehabilitation principles and surgical or conservative treatment, evaluation and treatment programs, theoretical and practical examples, preventative rehabilitation and patient's education.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. Innovation skills define the competencies that a physiotherapist must possess in order to stay current in their profession and thus contribute to the up-to-dateness of the national and global FTR community. In this context, it focuses on innovation and entrepreneurship features. Within the scope of PTR 313 course, it contributes to our students on the importance of adapting to innovations in daily and business life, the importance of generating new and different ideas, analyzing health environments, having information about newly applied rehabilitation methods and developing innovative ideas about the field.
course_learning_outcomes: To define general orthopedic rehabilitation principles.
To gain knowledge about spesific evaluation and treatment methods for ortopedic diseases.
To learn the basics of orthopedic assessments on lower and upper extremities.
To discuss the physiotherapy and rehabilitation by early or late application of approaches for orthopedic diseases
To define the etiologies, pathologies, and treatments of the lower (hip, knee,the foot and ankle) and  upper extremity (shoulder, elbow, wrist and hand).
To integrate knowledge and clinical skills to develop effective physiotherapy interventions for ortopedic diseases.
To plan appropriate rehabilitation and evaluation programs after conservative or surgical treatment of patients with orthopedic disorders.
To decide evidence based practice.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course includes the primary causes, clinical symptoms, diagnosis and prognosis of neurological diseases. Technical, technological and biopsychosocial approaches to physiotherapy and rehabilitation evaluations and treatments in neurological diseases are examined.
course_learning_outcomes: To define central and peripheral nervous system diseases.
To explain the movement disorders seen in neurological diseases and the pathologies that affect  activities of daily living.

To assess the reflex, tone, sensory, motor, cognitive and communicative disorders of the nervous system and their consequences affecting the vestibular, respiratory, circulatory, and urological systems.
To select and explain appropriate physiotherapy and rehabilitation methods in neurological diseases.
To apply techniques and treatments suitable for patient evaluation

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course includes theorical and pratical basis of Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation Techniques (PNF).
course_learning_outcomes: To learn the basic theorical knowledge about PNF techniques.
To gain practical skills to implement  PNF techniques
To apply PNF methods in the physiotherapy program of the patients with different diagnosis (orthopedic, rheumatologic, pediatric, etc.)
To learn Bobath exercises in sitting and in standing position and on late period.
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Jonstone concept and learn Johnstone early period and upper &lower extremity exercises.
To learn Johnstone motor development exercises and Johnstone gait training.
To determine rehabilitation program for patients according to neurophysiological approaches
To use  knowledge in the literature

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: There are biomechanical principles of orthosis, assessments before and after orthosis applications, orthosis for upper and lower extremities, spinal segments, orthosis use in musclesceletal and nerve system diseases, controls in orthosis and orthosis rehabilitation, causes, levels of amputation, congenital amputations, lower extremity prothesis, upper extremity prothesis, static and dynamic calibrations in prothesis, stump-socket adaptation, myoelectric prothesis, amputee rehabilitation subjects in the content of this course.
course_learning_outcomes: explain the differences and biomechanical principles of orthosis and prosthesis.
decide the appropriate orthosis and prosthesis according to the patient's condition.
evaluate the patient using orthosis or prosthesis.
define the parts, design and production stages of orthoses and prostheses.
plan and apply the appropriate rehabilitation program of the patient in accordance with the prosthetic phase.
plan and apply the appropriate rehabilitationrehabilitation program of the patient in accordance with the orthotics and splint phase.
use orthoses, orthotic devices and prostheses in physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
define possible complications of orthoses or prostheses and ways to avoid them.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course includes the risk factors, clinical symptoms, prognoses, treatments, and physiotherapy and rehabilitation approaches of common cardiovascular and respiratory diseases. The role and responsibilities of the physiotherapist are discussed in the prevention and improvement of health, the cardiopulmonary system of the people who receive physiotherapy, and the evaluation of their response to treatment. This course also examines biopsychosocial processes in the management of public health and chronic diseases. Evidence-based physiotherapy interventions for patients with acute and chronic problems and roles in the rehabilitation team are discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: To define the anatomical structures and functions of respiratory and cardiovascular systems.
To explain the pathologies of respiratory and cardiovascular systems that affect activities of daily living, exercise and endurance.
To explain the genetic, clinical and environmental factors that affect the prognosis and causes of common respiratory and circulatory diseases.
To select appropriate cardiopulmonary measurements in sick and healthy individuals, make them and evaluate the results.
To define evidence-based approaches to rehabilitation of individuals who need cardiopulmonary rehabilitation, within the framework of ethical principles.
To apply appropriate manual technique, exercise methods and assistive device to patients with respiratory and cardiovascular pathologies.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
The aim of this course is to give, knowledge, skills and attitude to student about  examine, evaluate and provide physiotherapy intervention for children with disabilities and special health care needs. This course gives knowledge in normal development, motor control and motor learning provides the basis for describing impairments of body function and structure and the physiotherapy rehabilitation management of activity and limitations common in selected neurological and musculoskeletal pediatric problems. PTR203 wellness and non-communicable diseases for children, rheumatic diseases in children PTR 321, PTR 308 cardiopulmonary diseases in children are taught in their classes.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. Innovation skills define the competencies that a physiotherapist must possess in order to stay current in their profession and thus contribute to the up-to-dateness of the national and global FTR community. In this context, it focuses on innovation and entrepreneurship features. Within the scope of PTR 320 course, it contributes to our students on the importance of adapting to innovations in daily and business life, the importance of generating new and different ideas, analyzing health environments, having information about newly applied rehabilitation methods and developing innovative ideas about the field.
course_learning_outcomes: To gain knowledge about typical and atypical development.
To have knowledge about motor learning.
To gain the ability to evaluate children and young people with developmental, neurological and orthopedic problems.
To learn the general principles of physiotherapy approaches in pediatric rehabilitation.
To choose evidence-based physiotherapy approaches for pediatric diseases and rehabilitate children with these methods.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course gives information about the classification, etiology, pathology, treatment options and physiotherapy rehabilitation program of rheumatological diseases in adults, youth and children. In this course, students gain knowledge, skills and attitudes compatible with the biopsychosocial model in the evaluation, planning and implementation of the physiotherapy rehabilitation program of rheumatic diseases.
course_learning_outcomes: Perform the necessary evaluations in line with professional knowledge, skills and behaviors in cases of rheumatological diseases that require physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
Plan the treatment program in accordance with the biopsychosocial model by analyzing the evaluations made in cases of rheumatological diseases that require physiotherapy and rehabilitation
Apply the program planned in accordance with the biopsychosocial model in rheumatological diseases that require physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
Define preventive and life facilitating approaches specific to rheumatological conditions.
Understand innovative, contemporary and technological approaches specific to rheumatic diseases by following current developments and information.

Perform behavior based on professional identity awareness and ethical sensitivity in professional practices specific to rheumatological diseases, in a patient-centered manner, in a multidisciplinary team approach consisting of different occupational groups.
Analyze and interpret the literature specific to rheumatic diseases.
Develop solutions based on knowledge, skills and attitudes towards rheumatic diseases.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
The aim of this course is to define health, the factors affecting health, to explain the role of physiotherapist in primary health care services, to explain preventive approaches, health promotion, preventive rehabilitation concepts for healthy people in the community and for people with chronic diseases.
The concept of health, What are the factors affecting health? ICF Role of physiotherapist in primary health care, Preventive approaches in physiotherapy, Health promotion, aims and examples of preventive rehabilitation programs, Examples of Preventive Rehabilitation Programs in Children and Elderly

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of learning skills basically defines the competencies that a physiotherapist should have in order to adapt to the work environment in which he will work after graduation and to contribute to the development of this environment. For the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field, there are four skill groups in this category as cooperation, creativity, problem solving and communication. Problem solving skills include the reasoning competencies that a physiotherapist should use when producing solutions/methods on professional cases or problems, especially clinical problems, while applying and improving this solution/method. In this direction, it focuses on developing problem solving, critical thinking and reflective thinking (reflective reasoning) skills. Within the scope of this course, the focus will be on developing innovative reasoning skills from the perspective of public health protection policies.
course_learning_outcomes: To define health, factors affecting health (biopsy-social model)
To define preventive rehabilitation practices.
To explain the role of physiotherapist in primary health care.
To explain examples of preventive rehabilitation in diseases in primary health care services.
To explain the International Disability Classification system.
To explain physiotherapy and rehabilitation methods for the protection of health for healthy people.
To explain physiotherapy and rehabilitation methods for the protection of health for people with chronic diseases.
To prepare reports in order to improve health and protect health.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
It is a Vocational Education course in Business. General Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation, Orthopedic Rehabilitation and Neurological Rehabilitation practices are carried out in one-month rotations in clinics approved by the course instructor. The student reports the patients he/she has followed in all three rotations, gets his/her supervisor approved, and submits them to the responsible lecturer of the course. I., II., III. In the orientation weeks included in the weekly content for rotations (the rotation is changed in the 1st, 5th and 10th weeks); Information is shared about the conditions of the clinic where the students are located (number of outpatients/inpatients, patient profile, number of Fzts, team and equipment features), and monitoring recommendations are given.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of learning skills basically defines the competencies that a physiotherapist should have in order to adapt to the work environment in which he will work after graduation and to contribute to the development of this environment. For the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field, there are four skill groups in this category as cooperation, creativity, problem solving and communication. Communication skills define the face-to-face and online social interaction skills that a physiotherapist should have as a basic feature of their profession. In addition to expressing oneself well, it includes the competencies of active listening, discussion and empathy. Within the scope of the PTR 401 course, our students are able to practice clinical practice in different institutions, improve their communication skills, contribute to the communication of patients-therapist, therapist-other healthcare professionals in institutions with different populations such as government, private, and more local institutions, in addition to their gains in communication skills during the course periods. In addition to contributing to various communication skills such as learning how to express effectively, they also gain the skills to communicate and transfer their knowledge experience in different environments thanks to the online or face-to-face presentations they make in the classroom.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of learning skills basically defines the competencies that a physiotherapist should have in order to adapt to the work environment in which he will work after graduation and to contribute to the development of this environment. For the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field, there are four skill groups in this category as cooperation, creativity, problem solving and communication. Problem solving skills include the reasoning competencies that a physiotherapist should use when producing solutions/methods on professional cases or problems, especially clinical problems, while applying and improving this solution/method. In this context, complex problems that arise in clinical settings will be discussed in the PTR 401 course, weekly meetings.
course_learning_outcomes: To develop professional behavior in the clinic and demonstrates commitment to learning.
To establish appropriate communication with the patient, patient relatives and rehabilitation team.
To select and measure relevant health indicators and outcomes.
Appropriately defines and interprets the evaluation results.
To select appropriate targets and intervention in collaboration with team and patient.
To perform the intervention appropriately.
To monitor and appropriately advance the impact of the intervention.
To identify adverse situations and minimize associated risk.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course aims to define orthopedic and neurological problems, determine appropriate FTR approaches, and develop evidence-based medical knowledge and patient-centered clinical problem solving skills of the student participating in clinical field studies. Current information on evaluation and treatment methods in orthopedic and neurological rehabilitation and comprehensive biopsychosocial approaches are examined.
course_learning_outcomes: To define the role and responsibilities of the physiotherapist in orthopedic and neurological rehabilitation services.
To select and measure relevant health indicators and explain the factors affecting its prognosis.
To select and plan evidence-based targets and interventions.
To explain the effect mechanisms of the intervention.
To identify treatment-related negative responses and perform risk management.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: For students to learn by experiencing the process of producing knowledge in the field of physiotherapy and rehabilitation and to internalize evidence-based practices; determines the research area through observation (lectures, clinical practices, scientific meetings attended, etc.), develops the research question/hypothesis by scanning the literature in the area he has determined, choosing the sample by defining the research method, choosing the measurement method and preparing the questionnaire/question forms, collecting data, data entry It includes data control, analysis and presenting the findings with methods such as tables and graphs, discussing the findings and developing suggestions based on the findings.
course_learning_outcomes: To do a literature review
To develop research question/hypothesis
To choose the research method suitable for the research question/hypothesis
To prepare measurement tools by determining the measurement method
To apply assessment tools

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
It is a Vocational Education course in Business. General Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation, Pediatric Rehabilitation and Cardiopulmonary Rehabilitation practices are carried out in one-month rotations in clinics approved by the course instructor. The student reports the patients he/she has followed in all three rotations, gets his/her supervisor approved, and submits them to the responsible lecturer of the course. I., II., III. In the orientation weeks included in the weekly content for rotations (the rotation is changed in the 1st, 5th and 10th weeks); Information is shared about the conditions of the clinic where the students are located (number of outpatients/inpatients, patient profile, number of PTs, team and equipment features), and monitoring recommendations are given.

In addition to contributing to various communication skills such as learning how to express effectively, they also gain the skills to communicate and transfer their knowledge experience in different environments thanks to the online or face-to-face presentations they make in the classroom.

To discuss the findings within the framework of consistency, which is the criterion of causality
To develop suggestions based on the findings

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
In this course; In physiotherapy, it is aimed to identify problems with the ability to identify problems in cases involving cardiopulmonary rehabilitation and pediatric rehabilitation, and to develop evidence-based medical knowledge and patient-centered clinical problem-solving skills. Treatment is planned by discussing case reports.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of learning skills basically defines the competencies that a physiotherapist should have in order to adapt to the work environment in which he will work after graduation and to contribute to the development of this environment. In addition to expressing oneself well, it includes the competencies of active listening, discussion and empathy. In the PTR 408 course, group work and oral presentations are made in the classroom.
course_learning_outcomes: To define congenital and acquired pathologies.
To measures respiratory disorders, defines abnormal findings, and evaluate physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
To identify abnormal findings of the heart and circulatory system, make physiotherapy and rehabilitation evaluations.
To make pediatric evaluations of different systems in sick and healthy children.
To make preventive rehabilitation plans for different age groups.
To discuss appropriate physiotherapy and physical activity approaches in different disease groups.
To update knowledge with evidence-based literature research.
To follow evidence-based innovations.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Learning the structure and normal functioning principles of the body, cells, tissues and organs in healthy individuals.
course_learning_outcomes: The students will be able to explain the human body on how the body response to a stimuli.
The students will be able to know explain various organs in the body function to maintain life.
The students will be able to explain the basis of understanding disease conditions.
List the physiological functions of various systems.
Describe the principles of regulation of function of the systems.
Apply the knowledge of human physiology to functional  situations
Apply the knowledge of human physiology to clinical situations
Explain normal function of the systems

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
Rehabilitation team and working principles, the role of the physiotherapist in the rehabilitation team, ethical principles, occupational measurement and treatment techniques, disability concept, special principles for children, adults and the elderly.
Work areas of the physiotherapist.
Introduction to basic rehabilitation courses (Orthopedic, pediatric, neurological, rheumatological, cardiopulmonary rehabilitation).
General introduction of heat-light and electrotherapy modalities applied in Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.
Teaching the terminology frequently used in physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of learning skills basically defines the competencies that a physiotherapist should have in order to adapt to the work environment in which he will work after graduation and to contribute to the development of this environment. For the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field, there are four skill groups in this category as cooperation, creativity, problem solving and communication. Communication skills define the face-to-face and online social interaction skills that a physiotherapist should have as a basic feature of their profession. In addition to expressing oneself well, it includes the competencies of active listening, discussion and empathy. Within the scope of PTR 133, he gains the skill of group work, lays the foundations of how to access evidence-based information, learns about diseases, shares the information he has gained with his group friends, learns communication skills with his friends and future colleagues, and learns to convey the information he has acquired using correct expressions.
course_learning_outcomes: To define physiotherapy and rehabilitation education.
To gain knowledge about physiotherapy and rehabilitation professional practices.
To define the modalities used in physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
To define physiotherapy and rehabilitation practices
To learn the rehabilitation application areas.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: The history and basics of electrotherapy, Galvanic currents, Faradic currents/Sinusoidal currents, Diadynamic currents, Medium frequency currents, TENS, Russian currents, Micro currents, High Voltage currents, Magnetotherapy, Traction effect and related applications will be explained within the scope of these courses. Evidence-based electrotherapy features of this evidence will be discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: Know  the basic principles and procedures of  electrotherapy modalities.
Know the physiological and therapeutic effects of the different electrotherapy modalities and the application methods of these modalities.
Describe the indications, contraindications, dangers and precautions of the electrotherapy modalities.
Acquire the skill of application of the electrotherapy agents, for the purpose of treatment.
Plan the appropriate electrotheraphy programs.
Describe mechanism of  indications and contraindications of electrotherapy modalities in different illnesses.
Explain the effects of electrotherapy modalities on human body

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course covers growth and development, terminology and development theories, neural development of the central nervous system, brain and plasticity, definition of healthy newborn, first examination of newborn, normal development process of child from prenatal to adolescence, cognitive motor development of human, premature baby, birth trauma, Congenital deformations, diseases of the newborn, examination of the late-born child, evaluation of the effects of aging on the body and quality of life, aims and results of rehabilitation in the aging process from birth to old age, aims and results of rehabilitation in old age.
course_learning_outcomes: Identify all processes of the life stages which are different from each other from birth to death.
Understand the process of growth and development and importance of keeping these processes in a healthy way.

Distinguish the normal and abnormal patterns and reflexes seen in the growth and development process of the infant, the milestones of human developmental stages and physiological developmental periodical expectations.
Describe normal growth and development expectations,abnormalities and rehabilitation needs of toddler, pre-school, school age, adolescent, adult and elderly stages of life.
Define neural plasticity concept and  understand interactions and changes of neural mechanisms throughout the growth an development process.
Describe motor skill development throughout the life span.
Identify the progression of normal gross and fine motor development throughout the life span.
Discuss the influence of wellness activities on motor skill abilities throughout the life span.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: In this course, the normal shape, structure, organs of the human body and the structural and functional relationships between these organs will be discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: List the concepts, definitions and terms of the anatomical structures of the body.
Describes the localization and features of the anatomical structures of the body.
Explain the structure and morphology of muscles, bones and joints.
Explains the structure of all body systems and the relationship between structure and function.
Establishes a cause-effect relationship between the functional relationships of body systems with each other.
Count the morphological features and functions of all organs that make up the body systems.
Defines important anatomical regions, structures and organs on the living body with their functions, knows the projection of the organs and shows their locations.
Use the basic knowledge of anatomy acquired to the field of health sciences education.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Learning the structure and normal working principles of organs and systems in healthy individuals
course_learning_outcomes: Establishes a cause-effect relationship about how various systems work in order for the human body to maintain life
Analyzes the relationship of mechanisms underlying disease conditions with systems.
Infers when the organism will show deviations in relation to the systems.
Makes definitions about main physiology.
Explain the physiology of systems.
Defines the principles of organizing the functions of systems.
Analyse physiological responses & adaptation to environmental stresses

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: In this course, it is aimed to understand the basic principles of heat and light therapies and their effects on inflammation, pain and edema. The physiological effects and clinical applications of rays in the wavelengths of the heat and electromagnetic spectrum are discussed and shown in practice. The thermal, mechanical and chemical properties of hydrotherapy and clinical practice knowledge and skills are developed. This course includes clinical applications of basic thermal therapy agents, cryotherapy, hydrotherapy, balneotherapy, aquatic physiotherapy used in physiotherapy.
course_learning_outcomes: To gain the necessary physics knowledge for heat, light and hydrotherapy modalities used in physiotherapy.
To define heat, light and hydrotherapy agents, explain their physiological, chemical and clinical effects.
To know the application indications and contraindications of these treatment agents.
To practice heat, light and hydrotherapy in physiotherapy.
To decide on the clinical use of different heat agents.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Central nervous system -whole brain, the cerebral hemispheres and function, basal ganglia, extrapyramidal system, diencephalon, thalamus, subthalamus, epithalamus, hypothalamus, the midbrain, brain stem, brain circulation. Ventriculus and constitution of brain –medulla fluid. Meninges. Medulla spinalis and structure. Down and up pathway. Plexus brachialis, plexus cervicalis, plexus lumbo–sacralis and nerves from plexus. Cranial nerves and their ganglia and nüclei. Autonomous nervous system – ympathic and parasympathic nervous system and its ganglia. Hormones –hypophysis, epiphysis, thyroid, parathyroid, suprarenal, thymus, ovary, testis, pancreas. All of the glands structures, vessels and innervations. Sense organs –sight, hearing, taste, smell and integumental organs and their structures, vessels and innervations.
course_learning_outcomes: Describe the structure and function of the nervous system
Define a motor unit. A cross-sectional diagram of the spinal cord
Identify and describe the cranial and peripheral nerve pathways, muscular and cutaneous innervation in the head, neck, trunk, upper extremity and lower extremity.
Explains the morphology of brain hemispheres, functional areas of cerebral cortex and their pathologies. Explains the structural organisation of white medullary substance.
Defines basal ganglia and cerebellum, explains their functions. Defines structural organisation of diencephalon.
Defines autonomous nervous system and its functions.
Shows lymbic system structures and explain their functional relationship. Defines autonomous nervous system and its functions.
Defines the meninges and explain the arterial and venous circulation of central nervous system.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
Introduction to the physiotherapy profession; teaching job description, application areas, laws and regulations and ethical rules relevant to area of physiotherapy practice.
Introduction to use knowledge of applied and basic medical (anatomy, physiology, histology, pathology, microbiology, etc), physical science (chemistry, physics, mathematics) and social science (psychology, sociology, anthropology, philosophy) in the field of physical therapy and rehabilitation. 
Introduction to integrated approach in physiotherapy and rehabilitation applications
Case studies in health sciences using interactive methods (problem solving, video analysis, literature search, group working, preparing report, oral presentation) to gain self-learning ability,  knowledge and skills for assessment and finding solutions in the cases with health problems.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of learning skills basically defines the competencies that a physiotherapist should have in order to adapt to the work environment in which he will work after graduation and to contribute to the development of this environment. In addition to expressing oneself well, it includes the competencies of active listening, discussion and empathy. Within the scope of PTR 144, she gains the skill of group work, lays the foundations of how to access evidence-based information, learns about diseases, shares the information they have gained with her group friends, learns communication skills with her friends and future colleagues, and learns to transfer the information she has acquired using correct expressions.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. The field of literacy skills, in its simplest form, is a physiotherapist's ability to distinguish reliable information sources and truth from unreliable and false ones, to distinguish the broadcasting companies and technology behind information sources, and to access and benefit from the most accurate and reliable information with this perspective. defines the required competencies. Information literacy skill group is included in this category for the Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Field. Information literacy skills include the competencies that a physiotherapist should possess while making use of up-to-date occupational technologies, as well as using online information, generating information and being involved in online learning processes. In this context, it includes using professional technologies, making use of accurate and reliable information sources appropriately, producing and disseminating information online, being present in social networks, online learning and effective use of information technologies for all these purposes. Within the scope of the PTR 144 course, our students gain the skills to distinguish reliable information sources and truth from unreliable and false ones, to distinguish the broadcasting companies and technology behind information sources, and to reach the competencies they need to access and benefit from the most accurate and reliable information in the student and lifelong learning processes.
course_learning_outcomes: To gain the necessary knowledge, skills and attitude to be a qualified professional in the field of health.
Learn the ethical principles that physiotherapists must follow.
To learn interprofessional approaches.
To learn communication methods in health sciences.
To use lifelong learning methods.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Exercise Physiology course includes the responses of the systems in the body in different exercise types, the changes in the responses in the systems due to environmental changes, and the evaluation of exercise capacity. Within the scope of this course, the responses in the musculoskeletal, nervous, cardiovascular, respiratory and endocrine systems during aerobic and anaerobic exercises are taught to the students. The skills to be acquired within the scope of practice courses are the application of exercise tests, the evaluation of functional capacity and the evaluation of vital signs during exercise and their interpretation according to normal values. In addition, determining an exercise program for sedentary and active individuals is another skill.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain how the body physiologically adapts to exercise or physical activity.
Describe the acute and chronic responses of the heart, circulatory and respiratory systems to exercise.
Explain the principles and basic concepts of anaerobic and aerobic exercise training.
Explain energy transfer in the body, energy expenditure during rest, physical activity and exercise.
Define the effects of personal and environmental factors on exercise.
Explain the basic physiological responses after exercise.
Measure acute and chronic responses to exercise, and assess functional exercise capacity.
Create exercise prescription and plan the program.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course covers planes and axes and movements of joints, correct posture, and alignment, posture analysis (front, back, and side), muscle length and flexibility tests, anthropometry measurements, circumference and diameter measurements of extremities, head, trunk, and extremity length measurements, and goniometric measurements of joints, manual muscle testing of body muscles, which is one of the most important and basic techniques used in physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
course_learning_outcomes: Understand and describe correct posture and asses the posture and identify postural problems.
Apply muscle shortness-flexibility tests  and find out the problems and will be able to apply antropometric measurements, circumferential and diametric measurements.
Perform joint range of motion analysis by goniometric measurements. and define limitations, be aware of the rules to follow while performing these assesments.
Standardize manual muscle test procedures, perform it, identify modification needs, compare the results and define muscle weakness and rehabilitation needs.
Define neck and trunk muscles, their functions, nerve innervations and segments and how to apply manuel muscle testing on them.
Define upper and lower extremity muscles,their functions,innervations and segments and applying manuel muscle testing on them.
Define fascial muscles, their functions, nerve innervations and segments and how to apply manuel muscle testing on them.
Performs the management of the appropriate measurement and evaluation methods for individuals with different health problems or healthy.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: The aim of this course is to introduce students to the definition of kinesiology and kinematics, bone and joint kinematics, skeletal-muscle interaction, basic structure, function and composition of joints, structure, types, function and mechanics of function of muscles, kinetic chains, bone structure, types and composition, on bone stresses, structure, properties, kinetics of cartilage tissue, properties of collagen tissue, kinetics, general mechanical principles, movement and movement types, balance, orientation planes and coordinates, trunk (head-neck, trunk) kinetics, upper extremity (shoulder) -arm, elbow, hand-wrist) kinetics, lower extremity (pelvis, hip, knee, foot-ankle) kinetics, columna vertebralis kinetics, spinal plane problems (scoliosis, kyphosis, lordosis, etc.), about normal and pathological gait issues.
course_learning_outcomes: Define kinesiology, kinetics, and kinematics.
Define the structures and functions of muscle, bone, joint, cartilage and collagen tissues.
Define general mechanics principles, motion and motion types, balance, orientation planes, and coordinates.
Explain the trunk (temporomandibular joint, head-neck, trunk) and columna vertabralis kinesiology.
Explain the upper extremity and lower extremity kinesiology.
Define normal and pathological gait analysis.
Perform kinematic analysis of motion in active and stable positions.
Use biomechanical and kinesiological principles while assessing a person, planning an exercise or modifying an exercise.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: It includes general introduction to physiotherapy methods applied within the scope of neurodevelopmental therapy, theoretical and practical information of Bruunstrom, Bobath and Johnstone approaches.
course_learning_outcomes: To learn theoretical principles and practical application of Bruunstrom, Bobath and  Johnstone concepts.
To learn assessment principles of Bruunstrom, Johnstone and Bobath  approaches and to comparison of treatment approaches on cases
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Bruunstrom concept and learn upper and lower extremity exercises of Bruunstrom Concept.
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Bobath concept and learn upper and lower extremity exercises of Bobath Concept.
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Johnstone concept and learn upper and lower extremity exercises of Johnstone Concept.
To evaluate and analyze neurological cases.
To plan the physiotherapy rehabilitation program of neurological cases.
To compare the treatment programs of neurological cases

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
This course covers the approaches in orthopaedic problems and the early and late rehabilitation principles and surgical or conservative treatment, evaluation and treatment programs, theoretical and practical examples, preventative rehabilitation and patient's education.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. Innovation skills define the competencies that a physiotherapist must possess in order to stay current in their profession and thus contribute to the up-to-dateness of the national and global FTR community. In this context, it focuses on innovation and entrepreneurship features. Within the scope of PTR 313 course, it contributes to our students on the importance of adapting to innovations in daily and business life, the importance of generating new and different ideas, analyzing health environments, having information about newly applied rehabilitation methods and developing innovative ideas about the field.
course_learning_outcomes: To define general orthopedic rehabilitation principles.
To gain knowledge about spesific evaluation and treatment methods for ortopedic diseases.
To learn the basics of orthopedic assessments on lower and upper extremities.
To discuss the physiotherapy and rehabilitation by early or late application of approaches for orthopedic diseases
To define the etiologies, pathologies, and treatments of the lower (hip, knee,the foot and ankle) and  upper extremity (shoulder, elbow, wrist and hand).
To integrate knowledge and clinical skills to develop effective physiotherapy interventions for ortopedic diseases.
To plan appropriate rehabilitation and evaluation programs after conservative or surgical treatment of patients with orthopedic disorders.
To decide evidence based practice.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course includes the primary causes, clinical symptoms, diagnosis and prognosis of neurological diseases. Technical, technological and biopsychosocial approaches to physiotherapy and rehabilitation evaluations and treatments in neurological diseases are examined.
course_learning_outcomes: To define central and peripheral nervous system diseases.
To explain the movement disorders seen in neurological diseases and the pathologies that affect  activities of daily living.

To assess the reflex, tone, sensory, motor, cognitive and communicative disorders of the nervous system and their consequences affecting the vestibular, respiratory, circulatory, and urological systems.
To select and explain appropriate physiotherapy and rehabilitation methods in neurological diseases.
To apply techniques and treatments suitable for patient evaluation

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: Manipulation is the use of the hands in patient management process using instructions and maneuvers to maintain maximal, painless movement of the musculoskleteal system in postural balance. This course aims to learn and practice physiological objectives of palpation and basic manipulative treatment techniques used in physiotherapy regarding anatomic and physiologic backgrounds and aspects.In this course the principles and theory of manipulation and mobilization techniques, positioning, indications and contraindications are explained.
course_learning_outcomes: explain the diagnostic and therapeutic value of palpation and manipulation in physiotherapy, can define the types and principles of manipulation and massage techniques.
apply classical massage techniques based on anatomical and physiological knowledge.
explain regional applications used in physiotherapy clinics and sports medicine.
explain and apply connective tissue massage.
explain the theory and basic principles of manipulation and mobilization techniques.
explain the application indications and contraindications of manipulation and mobilization techniques.
explain evidence-based theories supporting the use of manual therapy applications.
apply the necessary practices for applying manipulation and mobilization techniques.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: In this course, joint range of motion exercises, stretching and mobility exercises, strengthening exercises (isometrics, progressive resistance exercises, theraband exercises, isotonic weight training) exercises, isokinetic exercises, relaxation exercises, closed kinetic chain exercises, balance, coordination and deep sensory exercises, plyometric exercises, dynamic lumbar stabilization exercises, special exercises such as Mckenzie, Williams, Codman, Wand are discussed. Factors to be considered while designing an appropriate treatment program and prescribing exercise are emphasized. The most appropriate therapeutic exercise approaches for the client/patient are handled by considering the biopsychosocial model by determining long and short treatment goals.
course_learning_outcomes: To define the types and features of therapeutic and preventive exercises.
To understand diseases and health conditions for which therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches are appropriate.
To prepare exercise prescriptions specific to health and disease conditions by associating therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches with the evaluation results.
To understand how therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches should be applied and what should be considered.
To determine the necessary modifications by following the programs prepared for therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches.
To gain basic skills and knowledge that can diversify therapeutic and preventive exercise approaches.
To plan and apply therapeutic and preventive exercises in accordance with the biopsychosocial model.
