To interpret the literature by following the innovations related to therapeutic and preventive exercise.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course includes theorical and pratical basis of Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation Techniques (PNF).
course_learning_outcomes: To learn the basic theorical knowledge about PNF techniques.
To gain practical skills to implement  PNF techniques
To apply PNF methods in the physiotherapy program of the patients with different diagnosis (orthopedic, rheumatologic, pediatric, etc.)
To learn Bobath exercises in sitting and in standing position and on late period.
To understand assessment of positioning, rolling, hand gripping techniques in Jonstone concept and learn Johnstone early period and upper &lower extremity exercises.
To learn Johnstone motor development exercises and Johnstone gait training.
To determine rehabilitation program for patients according to neurophysiological approaches
To use  knowledge in the literature

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course includes the risk factors, clinical symptoms, prognoses, treatments, and physiotherapy and rehabilitation approaches of common cardiovascular and respiratory diseases. The role and responsibilities of the physiotherapist are discussed in the prevention and improvement of health, the cardiopulmonary system of the people who receive physiotherapy, and the evaluation of their response to treatment. This course also examines biopsychosocial processes in the management of public health and chronic diseases. Evidence-based physiotherapy interventions for patients with acute and chronic problems and roles in the rehabilitation team are discussed.
course_learning_outcomes: To define the anatomical structures and functions of respiratory and cardiovascular systems.
To explain the pathologies of respiratory and cardiovascular systems that affect activities of daily living, exercise and endurance.
To explain the genetic, clinical and environmental factors that affect the prognosis and causes of common respiratory and circulatory diseases.
To select appropriate cardiopulmonary measurements in sick and healthy individuals, make them and evaluate the results.
To define evidence-based approaches to rehabilitation of individuals who need cardiopulmonary rehabilitation, within the framework of ethical principles.
To apply appropriate manual technique, exercise methods and assistive device to patients with respiratory and cardiovascular pathologies.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description:
The aim of this course is to give, knowledge, skills and attitude to student about  examine, evaluate and provide physiotherapy intervention for children with disabilities and special health care needs. This course gives knowledge in normal development, motor control and motor learning provides the basis for describing impairments of body function and structure and the physiotherapy rehabilitation management of activity and limitations common in selected neurological and musculoskeletal pediatric problems. PTR203 wellness and non-communicable diseases for children, rheumatic diseases in children PTR 321, PTR 308 cardiopulmonary diseases in children are taught in their classes.

Within the scope of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Core Education Programs (CEP), innovative skills foreseen for Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Area are classified as learning skills, literacy and life and career skills. Innovation skills define the competencies that a physiotherapist must possess in order to stay current in their profession and thus contribute to the up-to-dateness of the national and global FTR community. In this context, it focuses on innovation and entrepreneurship features. Within the scope of PTR 320 course, it contributes to our students on the importance of adapting to innovations in daily and business life, the importance of generating new and different ideas, analyzing health environments, having information about newly applied rehabilitation methods and developing innovative ideas about the field.
course_learning_outcomes: To gain knowledge about typical and atypical development.
To have knowledge about motor learning.
To gain the ability to evaluate children and young people with developmental, neurological and orthopedic problems.
To learn the general principles of physiotherapy approaches in pediatric rehabilitation.
To choose evidence-based physiotherapy approaches for pediatric diseases and rehabilitate children with these methods.

Physiotherapy and Rehabilitation.course_description: This course gives information about the classification, etiology, pathology, treatment options and physiotherapy rehabilitation program of rheumatological diseases in adults, youth and children. In this course, students gain knowledge, skills and attitudes compatible with the biopsychosocial model in the evaluation, planning and implementation of the physiotherapy rehabilitation program of rheumatic diseases.
course_learning_outcomes: Perform the necessary evaluations in line with professional knowledge, skills and behaviors in cases of rheumatological diseases that require physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
Plan the treatment program in accordance with the biopsychosocial model by analyzing the evaluations made in cases of rheumatological diseases that require physiotherapy and rehabilitation
Apply the program planned in accordance with the biopsychosocial model in rheumatological diseases that require physiotherapy and rehabilitation.
Define preventive and life facilitating approaches specific to rheumatological conditions.
Understand innovative, contemporary and technological approaches specific to rheumatic diseases by following current developments and information.

Perform behavior based on professional identity awareness and ethical sensitivity in professional practices specific to rheumatological diseases, in a patient-centered manner, in a multidisciplinary team approach consisting of different occupational groups.
Analyze and interpret the literature specific to rheumatic diseases.
Develop solutions based on knowledge, skills and attitudes towards rheumatic diseases.

Law.course_description: Roman law constitutes the basis of European continental law on which the Turkish legal system is also based.  In this class, it will be emphasized how the legal institutions arose and developed.Through the examination of Roman law, the student will become familiar with the basic principles and rules. This course is particularly useful for those who are interested in the area of private law.
course_learning_outcomes: Analyze critically legal concepts, institutions and beliefs
Acquire knowledge about Roman Law's influence on modern law
Obtain knowledge about foundation of introductory concepts' of Turkish Code of Obligations in Roman Law
Compare concepts of Roman Law with modern law
Build connections between foundations of legal concepts of Roman Law and its reflection on modern law

Law.course_description: The purpose of this course is to describe the concepts of political power, sovereignty, democracy, human rights, separation of powers, the state and basic characteristics of the state, and to set forth the structure and functioning of legislative and executive bodies in a comparative perspective. This course aims to elaborate on the enactment of the constitution and other legal norms as well as the hierarchy between them in the context of Turkish constitutional law.
course_learning_outcomes: Define concepts of political power, sovereignty, democracy, human rights, separation of powers and state.
Identify how the above-mentioned concepts are defined in the international instruments.
Determine the different aspects of presidential, semi-presidential and parliamentary systems.
Describe the fundamental characteristics of unitary, regional and federal states.
Explain the structure and functioning of legislative and executing bodies in a comparative perspective.
Explain the enactment and implementation of the legal norms of the Turkish constitutional system.

Law.course_description: This course is divided into two parts: introduction to civil law and the law of natural persons. The aim of the first part is to enable students to understand the sources and the general principles of civil law. The second part of the course covers topics such as capacity, protection of personality and personal status.
course_learning_outcomes: understand that Civil Law is the main building stone of the entire law system.
step firmly on the infrastructure of law culture even at the very beginning of his education.
understand the economic and social background of legal provisions in general and civil law in special.
learn the healthy way of application of civil law rules with the help of case studies.
learn the special logical technique with regards to the implementation of juridical provisions.
solve concrete legal disputes during lots of practical studies in order to reinforce this methodological skill.
increase his/her satisfaction in learning the general theory of law.
be evaluated through home works, questions asked during the lessons, tests, intermediary and final examinations.

Law.course_description:
Law is a field of interest which regulates the human relations that may appear in different forms. In the light of this fact, the aim of this course is to scrutinize the conceptual and institutional framework of law. In this context, it is surely significant to obtain knowledge about the technical means and methods of law and skills regarding their effective use. However, it is also important to consider the position of law in a wider context and with a special comparative emphasis on methods which are used by the social sciences and the natural sciences. 

The major topics in this course for students who are at the initial stage of their legal education are analysis of the larger framework of law and its effect on social life in general and in the relations of daily life. This course aims at providing students in legal studies with a theoretical background and practical skills to examine the law in different aspects.
course_learning_outcomes: •	Detect the interrelations of law, philosophy, sociology and political theory.
•	Define and discuss about basic concepts of law, together with the social functions of the system.
•	Express conceptual arguments before the public and proceed with discussions in the field of law.
•	Demonstrate the skills of critical thinking and questioning that have been ?acquired in the course, employing legal concepts when necessary.
•	Make comparisons and textual analyzes, build connections between texts read ?and discussions made around the topics within the framework of the syllabus.
•	Sort out and evaluate social disorganizations and failures of legal applications in contemporary practice.

Law.course_description: English for Academic Purposes I is a course designed to develop the academic language and academic skills needed by students in order to be successful in their respective departments. Students will be guided through the various stages of writing, including planning, researching and collecting and organizing information. Students will be working with semi-authentic to authentic academic texts. The course aims to introduce efficient reading strategies to cope with such texts as well as to increase students' confidence and comprehensibility when delivering information in an academic setting. Academic writing, listening, speaking and reading skills development will be emphasized in the course. Additionally, students' skills in test-taking, paraphrasing, summarizing and note-taking will be developed.
course_learning_outcomes: recognize vocabulary and discern meaning from context
apply note-taking strategies for study
approach assessment with a required skill set
summarize a text in a written format
participate in a debate concerning topics discussed in class

Law.course_description: HTR 111, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims teaching some terms like social science, history, revolution, counter-revolution, coups d’etat, state, political power, authority, law, rights etc. The module also aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman society, which is important to understand the conditions of Turkish Revolution. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To discuss some terms like "social science", "history", "revolution", "coups d'etat", "state", "political power", "authority", "law", "rights" etc.
To understand what the political, social and economic structure of Ottoman Empire was
To understand the differences between Ottoman land formation and feudalism.
To understand what Ottoman modernization was.
To discuss what Ottoman modernization was.

Law.course_description:
The aim of this lecture is to teach any student who has finished its undergraduate studies, to acknowledge and learn the structure and the functionality of the Turkish language, from the perspective of linguistic and thought relation, to implement the skill to use the Turkish language right and effective as a written and spoken expression tool.
By teaching the historical process of the Turkish language, its place in the universal linguistic families, analyzing the important shifts and transformations of the Turkish language, and carefully teaching the sets of dictation, this lecture is set to transpose an overall knowledge and practical skill sets to students.
course_learning_outcomes: Understanding the fundamental concepts of the Turkish language, its historical process, and the ability to reflect these learnings in daily life.

Establishing the skill to understand the main takeaways of this course and further use these capacities to compare the Turkish language with other languages, detecting puzzles and issues within this comparison and address rational responses to such problems.

Learning the structural and conceptual aspects of the Turkish language, improving overall knowledge about the language for better evaluation and analysis, and to attain the ability to do accurate research and rational answers when being questioned about this field.

Learning the unique relationship of the language with other disciplines which will contribute greatly to the intellectual accumulation of the student(s) to use the language with awareness and originality.
To care about the oral and written set of rules of the Turkish language and raising awareness.

Law.course_description: This course focuses on the development of the Turkish Constitutions since the Ottoman Empire and concepts of democracy, secularism, rule of law, welfare state, human rights and the principle of equality, also defined as the principles of the Republic in the Constitution. This course also embraces topics such as, but not limited to, political parties, electoral systems, freedom of expression and association, freedom of religion, constitutional proceedings, independence of the judiciary, right to a fair trial and social rights. The emergence and functioning of the judicial review of constitutionality and the European Convention on Human Rights will be particularly emphasized whilst encouraging students to analyze the judgments of these judicial bodies.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain theoretical knowledge concerning emergence of constitutions and the need for a constitution.
Compare development of the constitutional law in Turkey within a historical perspective.
Describe basic elements, positive and negative aspects of constitutional order, constitution making processes and implementation of the constitutions in Turkey with a comparative approach.
Interpret the notions of democracy, rule of law, welfare state, human rights, secularism and equality through current international standards.
Illustrate how the above-mentioned notions are handled by national and international judicial bodies.

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to give the students detailed knowledge on family law. This course will focus on engagement, marriage, divorce, paternity and guardianship.
course_learning_outcomes: At the end of this course, the students will comprehend how civil law approaches to the concept of family and the formation of marriage, general provisions and divorce.
At the end of this course, the students will understand and learn the kinship and parentage relations,
At the end of this course, the students will have idea on how the legal procedure on various lawsuits (divorce, kinship) is conducted,
At the end of this course, the students will obtain information on rights of children and protection of children and women.
At the end of this course, the students will analyze the global understanding and evolution of the concept of family in terms of Family Law,
At the end of this course, the students will improve their skills on interpretation and argument upon analyzing court decisions on Family Law.

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to provide sound background knowledge of the history of Turkish Law. The course is designed to examine pre-Islamic and Islamic legal systems that have been applied during Turkey's history. Topics include pre-Islamic Turkish law, the Mecelle and the history of modern Turkish law.
course_learning_outcomes: -	Define and interpret Turkish law as a product of a historical process.
-	Evaluate legal concepts and foundations within their historical context.
-	Compare and analyze history of western law with that of Turkish-Islamic law.
-	Develop critical approaches to the mainstream understanding(s) of history.
-	Appreciate  cultural richness of Anatolia  and define elements thereof within Turkish legal history.

Law.course_description: Law is a field of interest which regulates the human relations that may appear in different forms. In the light of this fact, the aim of this course is to scrutinize the conceptual and institutional framework of law. In this context, it is surely significant to obtain knowledge about the technical means and methods of law and skills regarding their effective use. But, it is also important to take into account the position of law in a wider context and with a special comparative emphasis on methods which are used by the social sciences and the natural sciences. The major topics in this course for students who are at the initial stage of their legal education are analysis of the larger framework of law and its effect on social life in general and in the relations of daily life.
course_learning_outcomes: understand philosophical issues underlying legal institutions.
demonstrate the skills of critical thinking and questioning that have been acquired in the course, employing legal concepts when necessary.
Make comparisons and textual analyses, build connections between texts read and discussions made around the topics within the framework of the syllabus.
improve creative reading comprehension.
be familiar with the terminology, concepts, and theoretical aspects of the law.

Law.course_description: English for Academic Purposes II is a course designed to further develop and expand upon the academic language skills needed by students in order to be successful in their academic departments. Students will be guided through the various stages of writing, including planning, researching and collecting and organizing information. Students will be working with semi-authentic to authentic academic texts. The course aims to introduce efficient reading strategies to cope with such texts as well as to increase students' confidence and comprehensibility when delivering information in an academic setting. Academic writing, listening, speaking and reading skills development will be emphasized in the course. Additionally, students' skills in paraphrasing, summarizing and note-taking will be further developed.
course_learning_outcomes: understand the components of a case
read case materials in preparation for analysis
prepare a case for a specific audience
write a case  to a specific audience
deliver a case to a specific audience

Law.course_description: HTR 112, which is necessary to graduate from the university for all students, aims to accelerate students’ knowledge about the conditions of Turkish national war and Turkish revolution and foundation of Modern Turkish Republic. In addition, it is aimed to improve students’ views about the history critically and to know different perspectives about the historical events.
course_learning_outcomes: To understand the reasons of the Turkish National War, to define the Turkish National War
To compare Sevres Treaty and Lozan Treaty.
To understand and define the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To understand political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.
To discuss political and social change after the foundation of modern Turkish Republic.

Law.course_description: The aim of this lecture is to teach any student who has finished its undergraduate studies, the Turkish language’s academic and literary verbalism features, reaching to a certain intellectual level that allows the student(s) to evaluate and discuss the teachings of such features, and learn the historical process of the literature that has been developed in this field.
course_learning_outcomes: Improving writing skills in Turkish language by learning the fundamental concepts and spelling rules.

Conceptualizing the written expressions in the Turkish language and acquiring the ability to understand the differences between the types of expression which will contribute to the skill set of the student(s).
Learning the basics of the written expressions, the ability to compare the written expression types and reflect this knowledge into personal work in the future.

Improving the ability of students who has finished their undergraduate studies to carry the knowledge in this class to professional and academic life, which will enable the individual to better itself in expressing, critical thinking and greatly distinguish itself in written command
Acquiring the ability of originality in thinking and demonstrating and analyzing the literary pieces with critical thinking abilities.

Law.course_description: This course is designed to give students a theoretical and practical understanding regarding the first part of the general provisions of the Turkish law of obligations. The course focuses mainly on the law of contracts and especially on formation of contracts, authority of agents, validity issues, interpretation and content of contracts, performance and remedies in case of non-performance.
course_learning_outcomes: Analyze the law of contracts in general terms, having detailed information on the establishment and validity conditions, the interpretation and completion of contracts. which are among the sources of debts according to Turkish Code of Obligations.
Identify the non-performance and its enforcement according to Turkish Code of Obligations.
Identify disputes related to law of contracts and apply appropriate solutions to them derived from both the contract provisions and the substitute provisions of the Turkish Code of Obligations.
Summarize the opinions in the relevant literature and will be able to benefit from them in generating justification.
Critically analyze the provisions of the Code of Obligations and discuss the need of reform.
Understand the relationship between the special and the general provisions of Turkish Code of Obligations.

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to introduce students to the body of rules that regulate the relations between administration and individuals. The character of these rules, the structural meaning of 'administration', the administrative authorities which make up the administration and administrative activities (public services, police services) are the subjects of this course.
course_learning_outcomes: Identify the subject and the scope of administrative law.
Define the basic organization of the administration.
Distinguish the administrative activity of the administration from the ones of the legislation an judiciary.
Analyse the elements of administrative actions (competence, procedure, cause, subject, purpose).
Classify administrative actions.

Law.course_description: Criminal law is mainly concerned with those violations of social order which are regulated as ”crimes” by the legislative organ and their prescribed punishments. In this course, the terms of crime and punishment will be covered and the sources and general principles of criminal law and techniques of interpretation governing criminal law will be examined. After the introduction,  the general theory of crime will be analysed, whose main objective is to break down the crime into its components and analyse the theory of crime.
course_learning_outcomes: Comprehend the fundamental principles of criminal law
Detect and discern the rules concerning the application of the norms of criminal law and the elements of act and intent
Comment on and compare the legislation related to the basics of criminal liability
Determine the legal problem that lies within a case or judicial decision containing problems of criminal law
Apply the related norms of criminal law to the specific legal problem
Suggest solutions to the legal problem

Law.course_description: In this course, the concept of the modern nation-state will be analyzed through related concepts such as sovereignty, social contract, democracy, representation, and populism. In this examination, attention is given to the elements that qualitatively differentiate modern political structures and mentalities from other political structures and mentalities. On the other hand, a common model formed by a political/legal relationship of legitimacy will be analyzed in detail. Although the course focuses especially on early modernity's political/legal thought, it also establishes links between this transitory period and the present day through a critical lens.
course_learning_outcomes: develop a critical perspective on concepts such as state, sovereignty, social contract, democracy, and populism.
learn that the notions of state, sovereignty, social contract, democracy, and populism need to be thoroughly surveyed historically.
distinguish various legal/political foundations and mentalities with their historical processes and their specific qualities.
evaluate their own country’s experiences by surveying the origin of modernity in the 16th and 17th centuries in the West.
critically approach to the question of modernity by the theoretical equipment they acquired.

Law.course_description: The basic question of philosophy of law is ontological: “What is law?”. In this course, methods of acquiring knowledge on law and the relationship of law with other universes of thought and praxis are evaluated. Problems of existence (the formation and adoption of normative order) and language (indeterminacy–determinacy of law): the elements of law as a system (norms and principles) and its relations (the relationships of normative systems with each other) and, finally, the problem of value (natural law within the context of justice and freedom) are concentrated on and discussed. These discussions are evaluated in their contexts in the history of thought, with chronological leaps and special focus on contemporary thought.
course_learning_outcomes: Develop the skills of making general and systematical evaluations and analyzing law together with any neighboring discipline.
Criticize different positions in law and inspect the corresponding contemporary legal approaches.
Understand contemporary social problems and analyze these from a legal perspective, offer solutions.
Reflect critically upon legal institutions and regulation issues.
Employ legal concepts in interdisciplinary studies.

Law.course_description: This course is designed to give students a theoretical and practical understanding regarding the second part of the general provisions of Turkish Law of obligations. After having studied contracts as the major source of obligations in the first term, the second term will focus on the two other sources: torts and unjust enrichment. The theory of tort liability, limitation of liability, fault and strict liability as well as the different types of unjust enrichment and restitution will be dealt with. Beside these two major subjects students will be taught on different ways of discharging obligations, the effects of obligations on third parties, joint and several liability for an obligation, obligations on condition and the assignment of claims and assumption of obligations.
course_learning_outcomes: Analyze the general lines of tort law and unjust enrichment law, apply the provisions of the Turkish Code of Obligations.
Identify disputes regarding tortious and unjust enrichment and apply appropriate solutions to them derived from the Code of Obligations.
Determine the termination of debt.
Summarize the opinions in the relevant literature and will be able to benefit from them in generating justification.
Critically analyze the provisions of the Code of Obligations and discuss the need of reform.
Understand the relationship between the special and the general provisions of Turkish Code of Obligations.

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to further elaborate upon the foundation presented to students in the Administrative Law I course. The main subjects of this course  are administrative activities (public services, police, planning, state aids), administrative property and expropriation.
course_learning_outcomes: To distinguish the administrative activities from one and other such as  (public service, gendarmerie force, planning, promotion & subsidy, self-government.)
To learn how the public service actions are carried out.
To explain the inter relation between the actions of gendarmerie force and fundemental rights and liberties.
To understand that the planning, promotion & subsidy activities are independent activities of administration and to detect the different forms they take within the administrative activities.
To define the scope, the basic classification, the aim and manner of explotation  of public commodities.

Law.course_description: As part of this course, the concept of culpability, reasons diminishing and removing criminal capacity and culpability, mistake in criminal law, attempt, conspiracy, aggregation and sanctions of criminal law will be examined, within the general theory of crime.
course_learning_outcomes: Detect and discern the elements of lawfulness and criminal capacity related to criminal law
Define and classify specific terms related to crime such as attempt, conspiracy, facilitation, solicitation and concurrence
Comprehend the structure of a criminal sanction
Determine criminal liability in a criminal case at hand
Apply the norms of criminal law within the general provisions part of the Turkish Criminal Code to a particular legal problem
Suggest solutions to the legal problem

Law.course_description: This course aims at understanding law through sociology and evaluating the impacts of law in sociology. The relationship of law and society, especially the institutionalization of law within the complex structures of modern society, is the basic subject of the course. The course also develops and brings forth different points of view and solutions to problems about the profile and praxis of law in society. The discussions and research in these contexts produce a dynamic and living image of law in the eyes of the student.
course_learning_outcomes: •Learn the basic issues of sociology of law in reference to theoretical framework as well as law’s direct relation with everyday life;
•Approach law as a social phenomenon and as such analyze it from within the conceptual framework of sociology;
•Recognize and understand the principal schools of thought in sociology and the law;
•Contemplate upon the complex relation between law and the social world in reference to comparative works in the field;
•Every week discuss a different subject whereby the relation between law and social life can be observed in reference to the larger theorerical framework introduced in class;
•Recognize law’s different dimensions such as control, regulation, punitive, emancipatory or empowering and as such question the role of law in social life.

Law.course_description: The course will examine the law, policy and governance of Internet as well as other pressing topics in IT Law field. The main objective of this course is to explore most soaring topics in the IT Law field. The course will particularly focus on topics surrounding blockchain, internet law, AI, data protection and information privacy laws, cybersecurity and e-commerce laws. The increasing number of international, regional and national regulations and legal and ethical frameworks dealing with online ecosystem gave rise to complex frameworks that define roles, rights and obligations of different stakeholders. The lectures within this course will be carried out through in-class discussions; working groups and presentations in order to ensure active participation of the students. It is aimed to develop in-depth familiarity with a subset of the issues through intensive studies, discussions, and presentations.
course_learning_outcomes: Learn the historical development of Internet, a global information and communication tool, the current management methods of Internet, the determination method of rules, related Internet,
Demonstrate a critical knowledge of the pressing topics around AI, data protection law, blockchain and cybersecurity related laws.
Understand the underpinning theories and policies that explain international regulation of Internet and data protection laws and rules,
Understand the underpinning theories and policies that explain Turkey's regulation of Internet and data protection laws and rules,
Develop critical analysis skills when approaching interpretation of the laws relating to IT Law field.
Understand the essential discussions surrounding IT Law

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to explore substantive International Human Rights Law as well as international human rights monitoring mechanisms. In this regard, the main focus of the course will be the European Convention on Human Rights, as well as the case-law of the European Court of Human Rights. Discussion of the current national and international human rights issues will also be part of the course.
course_learning_outcomes: Use fundamental concepts and principles of international human rights law in the discussion of actual cases;
Explain the relationship between national law and international human rights law;
Apply international human rights treaty provisions to real life situations;
Know how the European Court of Human Rights work and the conditions for a successful application to the Court;
Discuss current issues in the light of international human rights law;
Evaluate the degree of compliance of the legislative, executive and judicial organs of the state with their human rights obligations.

Law.course_description: Fundamental concepts of administrative procedure law, effective judicial protection, human rights, freedom, scope and limits of administrative jurisdiction, administrative proceedings, judicial review of administrative effects of specific administrative procedures, administrative disputes and special trial procedures. These issues will be examined on the basis of positive legal regulations along with theoretical foundations and practical examples.
course_learning_outcomes: To define an effective judicial protection of fundemental rights and liberties from the administrative law perpective.
To learn the scope and limits of administrative jurisdiction.
To analyze administrative proceedings, special administrative judicial review of administrative procedures.
To discuss the effects of the Administrative Procedure Law.
To inspect the actual changes in the administrative jurisdiction.

Law.course_description: Property law is a component of civil law that is taught over a period of four years. In the first semester of this course, after completing a general introduction to property law, we will analyze the concept of goods, real rights and possession over property and land registry.
course_learning_outcomes:
Students who successfully complete this course, should be able
1.	To conceive the fundamental concepts related to the property law;
2.	To assess the legal issues, present in cases that fall under the scope of property law;
3.	To analyze the legal issues with the assistance of the concepts that they have learned during the class;
4.	To question the ratio legis of the provisions that regulate the property law;
5.	To assess court decisions that fall under the scope of property law by using the concepts and legal provisions that they have learned during the class.

Law.course_description: This course is designed to give students a theoretical and practical understanding regarding the Second Divison - The Individual Types of Contracts of Turkish Code of Obligations. The course focuses mainly on formation, interpretation and content of various contracts as well as their performance and remedies in case of non-performance. The focus of the course is particularly on the following contracts: sale, rental, work, mandate and surety.
course_learning_outcomes: name and classify contracts as per their different characteristics.
Explain the differences and similarities between contracts and assess which provisions of the code would apply to a certain contract at hand.
Present scholar opinions regarding a specific topic and rely on these while presenting an argument.
Critically discuss the provisions under the Code of Obligations and any need for a potential reform.
Lead the negotiations and drafting process of any contract regardless of whether it is regulated under the code or not.

Law.course_description: The Turkish Commercial Code assembles its general system on commercial enterprises. Commercial matters are covered by the Code, which describes as commercial any issue that is related to a commercial enterprise. The subject of the course includes commercial provisions and activities, commercial enterprises, commercial disputes and merchants and the status of the persons assisting merchants, namely commercial representatives, brokers, commercial middleman and agents.
course_learning_outcomes: Describe the concept of commercial enterprise in the context of commercial law.
Analyze the provisions of agreements regarding transfer and pledge of commercial enterprises,
Describe the concept of “merchant” which is the center of commercial law,
List the rights and obligations attributed to be a merchant,
Understand the organization of commercial enterprises and the commercial agents,
Compare and distinguish the commercial agents,
Recognize the legal protection provided by the provisions regarding trade mark and unfair competition,
Identify the convergence and divergence of commercial law with other fields of private law.

Law.course_description: The law of civil procedure is a branch of the law which regulates the enforcement of the rights of individuals under civil law, in the event that they are violated. The individual has a claim to his/her legal rights through a procedure known as a 'trial' in the state courts. Civil procedure law regulates the courts' structure, the trial, the status of the plaintiff and the defendant, filing the lawsuit.
course_learning_outcomes: explain basic concepts and institutions of civil procedure law
determine whether it is a non-contentious jurisdiction or not and which type of procedure (the written procedure or summary procedure) should be applied.
differentiate the basic stages of a case and identify the proceedings of each stage
perform the necessary procedural transactions in accordance with the civil procedure law from the emergence of the dispute until the final judgment.
take into account the fundamental rights and principles such as the right to a fair trial through the proceeding.
identify the roles, rights, and liabilities of actors of a case, i.e. the judge and attorneys
suggest alternative dispute resolution methods such as mediation apart from the judicial dispute resolution.

Law.course_description: The aim of the course is to analyze international public order and its legal basis. In this context, different aspects of world public order and their impact on law-making are also emphasized. Major topics in this course are sources and characteristics of international law and the jurisdiction of the state over its territory and its limitations. Specifically, international legal personality, statehood and recognition, sources of international law, customary international law and the law of treaties will be studied in depth. It is quite possible to access many legal resources for this course through the Internet.
course_learning_outcomes: - identify the subjects and sources of international law,
- explain the inception, nature and competences of States and International Organisations,
- evaluate the relevance of individuals, NGOs and corporations as actors or subjects of international law in light of contemporary developments,
- analyse the formation of customary international law rules and the phases of conclusion and operation of treaties,
- interpret the relationship between international law and Turkish law and,
- evaluate the impact international law may have for domestic legislation or adjudication.

Law.course_description: In the second part of the Property Law course, the concepts of ownership and limited real rights will be examined in depth. The notion of ownership will be addressed separately within the frameworks of immovable and movable property. As part of the discussion on limited real rights, servitudes, burdens on immovable property, and security rights in rem will be analyzed
course_learning_outcomes: conceive the fundamental concepts and principles related to the rights in rem on movable and immovable properties.
assess the legal issues, present in cases that involve the rights in rem on movable and immovable properties.
analyze the legal issues with the assistance of the concepts and principles that they have learned during the class.
question the ratio legis of the provisions that regulate property law.
assess court decisions that fall under the scope of property law by using the concepts and legal provisions that they have learned during the class.

Law.course_description: The course will begin with an explanation of the general principles of company law and distinctive features of companies regulated by the Turkish Commercial Code. Following this introduction, the establishment, functioning and termination of joint stock companies will be examined in detail. A second track in the same course will cover the law of negotiable instruments.
course_learning_outcomes: Recognize the different forms of commercial companies which are regulated by the Turkish Commercial Code numbered 6102
Differentiate the ordinary partnership agreements as regulated by the Turkish Code Of Obligations numbered 6098 from other forms of commercial companies,
Describe the responsibilities and liabilities of the board of directors, general assembly and auditors of a joint stock company,
Recognize the concept of “share” and “share transfer”,
Understand shareholder rights and actions aiming to protect such rights,
Recognize grounds of dissolution and procedure of dissolution in joint stock companies,
Make comparisons between the joint stock companies and limited liability companies
Recognize the concept of “negotiable instruments”, and acquire the basic knowledge regarding the types and practice of negotiable instruments.

Law.course_description: Civil Procedure Law II course deal with duties imposed on judges and parties to the trial for due conduct of the process, the proof of claims, which has for the judges a great importance in order to give judgement over the complaint, judgement and appeal procedures. Domestic arbitration ist topics of civil procedure as well.
course_learning_outcomes: To explain basic concepts and institutions of civil procedure law
To determine the judicial procedure relevant to the given dispute
To differentiate the basic stages of a case and identify the proceedings of each stage
To apply the civil procedure legislation to petitions and other legal acts from the start to the end of the dispute
To observe the basic rights and principles like the right to a fair trial during the judicial process and acts of parties and the courts regarding the process
To identify the roles, rights and liabilities of actors of a case, i.e. the judge and attorneys
To offer alternative dispute resolutions methods like mediation besides the judiciary to settle a dispute

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to introduce students to the crimes prescribed in Turkish Criminal Code and in other codes.The special provisions concern types of crimes classified according to their subject matter. Within this course, the general theory of the special provisions will be introduced and international crimes, crimes against persons and crimes against the reliability of the public administration and its functioning will be examined.
course_learning_outcomes: Comprehend the structure of different types of crimes stated within the Turkish Criminal Code and the other codes, apply the general provisions of Criminal Law to special provisions.
Identify the connection and distinction between crimes
Discuss and determine the norms that are to be applied to a specific case / problem that contains different types of crimes
Suggest solutions, upon the application of the norms specified to the particular case / problem
Analyze the current problems via the norms of criminal law

Law.course_description: As a subordinated work relation, not only parties to the contract but also mandatory rules determine the content of employment relationship. This course of Employment Law focuses mainly on the relations between employers and employees in the context of the individual employment relationship. The legal structure of the employment contract, the basic principles of employment law, employee's rights and obligations and the termination of the employment contract will be examined.
course_learning_outcomes: define the basic principles and concepts in labor law
detect labor law problems in a complex event.
apply legal regulations to juristic problems.
Evaluate labor law legislation and judicial decisions from different points of view
Can establish a relationship between the regulations in other legal branches and labor law regulations and analyze the intersection points in the light of the principles of labor law.

Law.course_description: The aim of the course is to analyze international public order and its legal basis. In this context, different aspects of world public order and their impact on law-making are also emphasized. Major topics in this course are sources and characteristics of international law and the jurisdiction of the state over its territory and its limitations. Specifically, international organizations the United Nations, peaceful settlement of disputes, maintenance of international peace and security and the law of the sea will be studied in depth. It is quite possible to access many legal resources for this course through the Internet.
course_learning_outcomes: v To explain international law rules on maintenance of international peace and order, territorial and extraterritorial jurisdiction of States including immunities, and law of the sea
- to analyse these rules critically in case scenarios, and
- to debate whether these rules are adequate to cover contemporary developments such as third generation peacekeeping operations and non-immunity of State representatives for international crimes,
- to describe the regulation of passage from the Turkish Straits, and
- analyse how general rules of the law of the sea are relevant to regulation of passage from the Turkish Straits

Law.course_description: The fundamental principles of tax law will be covered primarily as part of this course. After the basics of tax law, the following issues will be analysed and discussed in detail: General provisions regarding all types of taxes within the Turkish Tax Law system, the legal order to which a taxpayer will be subject to from the beginning of the tax till its payment, the rights and responsibilities of a taxpayer, the audit of a taxpayer, rules of fighting tax loss and tax evasion, tax crimes and sanctions and how to avoid them, tax enforcement law and general principles regarding the justice system.
course_learning_outcomes:
By obtaining in-depth information about the basic principles and constitutional bases of Tax Law, you can examine the reflections of these issues in practice,
The purposes of tax, its historical development, the scope of tax law, the distinctions and principles of tax law are learned.
Knows the sources of Tax Law, the application of tax laws and the phenomenon of tax privacy. Learns administrative resolution methods and tax jurisdiction in tax disputes.

Learns the taxation process, parties and procedure, the State's taxation authority, the connection of the taxation authority with democracy and the principle of the rule of law, the parties to taxation, the taxpayer, tax capacity and representation, the tax creditor, the tax administration, and the tax responsible in t

It can determine the types of tax and penal disputes that may arise between the parties to the tax and the provisions to be applied to them.
In taxation, he/she knows the tax person, the tax giving rise to the tax and its real nature.

With the in-depth knowledge gained about the administrative and judicial resolution methods of disputes, he can implement the relevant procedures, learn the tax assessment procedures, the taxation process, and the notification procedure of the tax.

Learns the tax accrual method, the tax collection method, the taxpayer's duties, the tax audit procedure, the situations that eliminate the tax debt, the fact that payment has been made, the statute of limitations, the correction and complaint method, the reconciliation procedure, the reduction in penalties, the facts
Knows the periods in the taxation process and tax law, learns the importance and qualities of the periods, the legal nature and consequences of the periods, and the extension of the periods.

Learns the crimes and penalties related to taxation, knows the general rules regarding tax crimes and penalties, the cancellation of tax penalties, and also learns the method of securing tax receivables by the administration, coercive pursuit and collection.

Law.course_description: This course aims at exploring both the private law and the public law issues applicable to international trade relations. The first and public law part of the course will focus on the main treaties regulating international trade as embodied in the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade and the World Trade Organization, as well as regional trade entities such as the European Union and the North American Free Trade Agreement. This part will examine the law applicable to tariff and non-tariff barriers, discrimination, regionalism, anti-dumping duties, countervailing duties, safeguard measures and the devices for international settlement of trade disputes. The second and private law part will deal with the key rules in international commercial transactions. To achieve this aim, the course will cover the fundamental characteristics of international sales of goods and essential contracts for the financing of trading activities, transportation of goods to their place of destination, settlement of disputes, and methods of payment in international commercial transactions.
course_learning_outcomes:
On successful completion, students are expected to:

-	distinguish between differing structures of the framework regulating international business transactions and global trading system
-	identify sources of international law relevant for conducting business internationally
-	identify the aim, function and organisation of the WTO (World Trade Organization) in the context of global trade and commerce
-	     identify the primary legal issues which usually arise from international business transactions
-	     gain a working knowledge of international sale of goods and the carriage of goods and thus enhance their skills in operating international business transactions
-	become acquainted with the language of international business transactions and global trade and the application of key concepts and theories to the current world practice

Law.course_description: Criminal procedure law is concerned with the enforcement of substantive criminal law. In this course, general and constitutional principles governing criminal procedure law, the role of human rights in criminal procedure systems, the structure of Turkish criminal courts and the main actors participating in criminal procedure law will be analyzed.
course_learning_outcomes: Detect the principles governing criminal investigation and the actors therein
Learn the distinguishing features of criminal procedure rules and understand the relation of this discipline to human rights and constitutional law
Ascertain the connections and distinctions between measures of protection
Determine norms that are applicable to a case containing problems concerning criminal investigation
Solve the problems upon the application of the norms decided on
Develop new policies after deliberating on the problems that lie within legislation and practice

Law.course_description: Enforcement law deals with the enforcement by the state of court orders, as well as with the forcing of payments of debts. Enforcement is divided into two categories: partial enforcement and bankruptcy. Partial enforcement occurs when there are several creditors of an unpaid debt, which has to be collected by the force of the state. In this case, a certain amount of the assets of the debtor is attached in order to satisfy the claims of the creditors. Bankruptcy will not be dealt with in this course.
course_learning_outcomes: explain the basic concepts and institutions of enforcement law.
distinguish the basic stages of execution proceedings and assess which procedures must be followed at each stage.
conduct the necessary procedures in accordance with the current enforcement law.
know the role, rights, and responsibilities of officers such as bailiffs, judges, and lawyers while having a good command of the enforcement bodies and their functions.

assess which execution procedure should be applied for in order to execute the rights of the creditor and also know which remedies would be able to apply for in order to oppose execution proceedings by the debtor.
precisely evaluate the balance of interest that needs to be established between the creditor and the debtor in an execution proceeding
understand the basic concepts and principles of Intellectual Property.
be knowledgeable about types of intellectual works, ownership, and contracts and will improve skills on interpretation of the debated issues.
apprehend the types of lawsuits for protection of the intellectual and industrial property rights and analyze the problems in practice.
be knowledgeable about the basics of the industrial law as such patents and industrial designs law.
analyse the court decisions and the debated issues on the conditions of legal protection and ownership of these rights.
obtain a global vision on the concept of “intellectual property” by analyzing the comparative law and especially international contracts and European regulations.

Law.course_description: The private international law course covers the legal relations and facts related to more than one legal system. As private international law has a wide scope of application, this course focused particularly on the conflict of  law rules which govern applicable law for a conflict having foreign element. Thus, the scope of this course is limited by the conflict of law rules. The purpose of this course is to provide to students a detailled knowledge of the general perpective of private international law and the conflict of law rules in the scope of Turkish Private International and Procedural Law and the international conventions ratified by Turkey. Particular attention is given to Turkish courts judgements and doctrine.
course_learning_outcomes: Identify the applicable law in private matters having cross-border implications.
Analyse whether the foreign applicable law is contrary to the public order of the forum state.
know how a Turkish judge applies foreign law
Evaluate international conventions ratified by Turkey.
Analyse international contracts.

Law.course_description: The course basically concentrates on the different types of insurance coverage available on the market. The subject of the course may be defined as the legal aspects of insuring risks and liabilities. It aims to provide a basic understanding of the general principles of insurance contracts under Turkish law. Issues such as the legal nature of insurance contracts, insured values and mutual liabilities of the insurers and the insured persons are covered.Explanations will be given under Turkish Commercial Code, No. 6102, that has been entered into force as of 1/7/2012
course_learning_outcomes: Conduct the procedure to set up insurance and reinsurance companies as well as intermediaries, such as agents and brokers
Conduct the procedure for foreign insurance companies to merge with or acquire existing Turkish insurance companies
Advise insurers and intermediaries on their duties under Regulatory law
Advise the parties in the drafting and negotiating of insurance contracts as well as on the application of statutory law, general conditions, particular conditions, clauses and foreign law
Provide legal advice according to the Insurance Law as set out in the Turkish Commercial Code and the Insurance Activities Act, as well as supplementary legislation
Conduct litigation and arbitration in disputes under insurance, reinsurance and agency agreements

Law.course_description: In this course, starting with the legal  principles governing the identification and collection of evidence, we will analyze the apprehension and indictment of criminals, interim measures, the procedure governing criminal trials and other proceedings and special regulations concerning organized crime. Upon successful completion of Criminal Procedure Law I and II, students will have gained a thorough perspective on how a criminal trial is and should be conducted.
course_learning_outcomes: Comprehend the rules governing the trial and judgement periods of criminal prosecution
Identify the application process and mechanisms regarding legal remedies / the review of a higher court
Explain the special adjudication processes and comment on the point where these processes differ from the general principles
Classify evidence and explain the methods of collecting evidence
Apply the norms decided on, to the particular case
Analyse and comment on the judicial decisions concerning criminal procedure and drawing conclusions therefrom

Law.course_description: Inheritance law, as a part of civil law, deals with the legal situation commencing with the death of a person. Following his death, any person leaves his assets to be inherited by his successors. Inheritance law covers the issues of the appointment of an heir, testamentary contracts, partition of succession and disinheritance.
course_learning_outcomes: deepen their knowledge in various branches of law, such as family law, property law, and law of obligations, while simultaneously refreshing and updating their previously acquired expertise—almost as if preparing for a baccalaureate exam.
enhance their legal vision through this multidisciplinary depth of knowledge
gain an understanding of the dialectical relationship and mutual interaction between property and inheritance rights and freedom of will.
learn to question the legitimacy of inheritance rights.
critically assess the economic function and social impact of inheritance rights and law.
recognize the economic and social background of legal rules, institutions, and theories; and learn to critically distinguish between earned and unearned wealth.
analyze the historical evolution of inheritance law in alignment with economic, social, and demographic developments.
develop the ability to resolve conflicts of interest in financial disputes through reconciliation.

Law.course_description: International procedural law, international arbitration, the nationality law and the legal status of aliens are the topics of this course. In this context, the first part of this course is focused on the general rules of international procedural law, the jurisdiction of Turkish courts and the recognition and enforcement of foreign judgments. The international arbitration which has become the usual method of settlement of international disputes constitutes the second part of this course. The aim is to provide students a basic and essential knowledge of international arbitration. The concept of international arbitration and the recognition and the enforcement of foreign arbitral awards compose the main topics of this part. Finally, the main matters of the nationality law and the legal status of aliens are the subjects that will be covered at the end of the semester. In this context, the principals of the nationality law, the acquisition and the loss of Turkish nationality, the rights of entry and residence of aliens in Turkey, the right to work and the right of acquisition of immovable property and foreign investment in Turkey are the topics.
course_learning_outcomes: Identify jurisdiction of Turkish courts for legal conflicts having cross-border implications.
Evaluate procedural rules applicable in conflicts having cross-border implications.
Evaluate the recognition and enforcement of foreign court’s judgments in Turkey.
Identify international arbitration.
Identify the rights of foreigners in Turkey.
Identify the acquisition and the loss of Turkish nationality.

Law.course_description: In this course, students are expected to evaluate a legal problem involving at least two legal disciplines from two different perspectives as a team and present it in writing and orally.
course_learning_outcomes: Systematically identify legal problems related to complex cases.
Conduct research on legal issues using national, international and comparative legal knowledge.
Solve complex legal problems.
Find the connection between different disciplines and sub-fields of law and their relation to each other.
Defend their opinions on legal issues in Turkish.

Law.course_description: Roman law constitutes the basis of European continental law on which the Turkish legal system is also based.  In this class, it will be emphasized how the legal institutions arose and developed.Through the examination of Roman law, the student will become familiar with the basic principles and rules. This course is particularly useful for those who are interested in the area of private law.
course_learning_outcomes: Analyze critically legal concepts, institutions and beliefs
Acquire knowledge about Roman Law's influence on modern law
Obtain knowledge about foundation of introductory concepts' of Turkish Code of Obligations in Roman Law
Compare concepts of Roman Law with modern law
Build connections between foundations of legal concepts of Roman Law and its reflection on modern law

Law.course_description: The purpose of this course is to describe the concepts of political power, sovereignty, democracy, human rights, separation of powers, the state and basic characteristics of the state, and to set forth the structure and functioning of legislative and executive bodies in a comparative perspective. This course aims to elaborate on the enactment of the constitution and other legal norms as well as the hierarchy between them in the context of Turkish constitutional law.
course_learning_outcomes: Define concepts of political power, sovereignty, democracy, human rights, separation of powers and state.
Identify how the above-mentioned concepts are defined in the international instruments.
Determine the different aspects of presidential, semi-presidential and parliamentary systems.
Describe the fundamental characteristics of unitary, regional and federal states.
Explain the structure and functioning of legislative and executing bodies in a comparative perspective.
Explain the enactment and implementation of the legal norms of the Turkish constitutional system.

Law.course_description: This course is divided into two parts: introduction to civil law and the law of natural persons. The aim of the first part is to enable students to understand the sources and the general principles of civil law. The second part of the course covers topics such as capacity, protection of personality and personal status.
course_learning_outcomes: understand that Civil Law is the main building stone of the entire law system.
step firmly on the infrastructure of law culture even at the very beginning of his education.
understand the economic and social background of legal provisions in general and civil law in special.
learn the healthy way of application of civil law rules with the help of case studies.
learn the special logical technique with regards to the implementation of juridical provisions.
solve concrete legal disputes during lots of practical studies in order to reinforce this methodological skill.
increase his/her satisfaction in learning the general theory of law.
be evaluated through home works, questions asked during the lessons, tests, intermediary and final examinations.

Law.course_description:
Law is a field of interest which regulates the human relations that may appear in different forms. In the light of this fact, the aim of this course is to scrutinize the conceptual and institutional framework of law. In this context, it is surely significant to obtain knowledge about the technical means and methods of law and skills regarding their effective use. However, it is also important to consider the position of law in a wider context and with a special comparative emphasis on methods which are used by the social sciences and the natural sciences. 

The major topics in this course for students who are at the initial stage of their legal education are analysis of the larger framework of law and its effect on social life in general and in the relations of daily life. This course aims at providing students in legal studies with a theoretical background and practical skills to examine the law in different aspects.
course_learning_outcomes: •	Detect the interrelations of law, philosophy, sociology and political theory.
•	Define and discuss about basic concepts of law, together with the social functions of the system.
•	Express conceptual arguments before the public and proceed with discussions in the field of law.
•	Demonstrate the skills of critical thinking and questioning that have been ?acquired in the course, employing legal concepts when necessary.
•	Make comparisons and textual analyzes, build connections between texts read ?and discussions made around the topics within the framework of the syllabus.
•	Sort out and evaluate social disorganizations and failures of legal applications in contemporary practice.

Law.course_description: This course focuses on the development of the Turkish Constitutions since the Ottoman Empire and concepts of democracy, secularism, rule of law, welfare state, human rights and the principle of equality, also defined as the principles of the Republic in the Constitution. This course also embraces topics such as, but not limited to, political parties, electoral systems, freedom of expression and association, freedom of religion, constitutional proceedings, independence of the judiciary, right to a fair trial and social rights. The emergence and functioning of the judicial review of constitutionality and the European Convention on Human Rights will be particularly emphasized whilst encouraging students to analyze the judgments of these judicial bodies.
course_learning_outcomes: Explain theoretical knowledge concerning emergence of constitutions and the need for a constitution.
Compare development of the constitutional law in Turkey within a historical perspective.
Describe basic elements, positive and negative aspects of constitutional order, constitution making processes and implementation of the constitutions in Turkey with a comparative approach.
Interpret the notions of democracy, rule of law, welfare state, human rights, secularism and equality through current international standards.
Illustrate how the above-mentioned notions are handled by national and international judicial bodies.

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to give the students detailed knowledge on family law. This course will focus on engagement, marriage, divorce, paternity and guardianship.
course_learning_outcomes: At the end of this course, the students will comprehend how civil law approaches to the concept of family and the formation of marriage, general provisions and divorce.
At the end of this course, the students will understand and learn the kinship and parentage relations,
At the end of this course, the students will have idea on how the legal procedure on various lawsuits (divorce, kinship) is conducted,
At the end of this course, the students will obtain information on rights of children and protection of children and women.
At the end of this course, the students will analyze the global understanding and evolution of the concept of family in terms of Family Law,
At the end of this course, the students will improve their skills on interpretation and argument upon analyzing court decisions on Family Law.

Law.course_description: This course is designed to give students a theoretical and practical understanding regarding the first part of the general provisions of the Turkish law of obligations. The course focuses mainly on the law of contracts and especially on formation of contracts, authority of agents, validity issues, interpretation and content of contracts, performance and remedies in case of non-performance.
course_learning_outcomes: Analyze the law of contracts in general terms, having detailed information on the establishment and validity conditions, the interpretation and completion of contracts. which are among the sources of debts according to Turkish Code of Obligations.
Identify the non-performance and its enforcement according to Turkish Code of Obligations.
Identify disputes related to law of contracts and apply appropriate solutions to them derived from both the contract provisions and the substitute provisions of the Turkish Code of Obligations.
Summarize the opinions in the relevant literature and will be able to benefit from them in generating justification.
Critically analyze the provisions of the Code of Obligations and discuss the need of reform.
Understand the relationship between the special and the general provisions of Turkish Code of Obligations.

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to introduce students to the body of rules that regulate the relations between administration and individuals. The character of these rules, the structural meaning of 'administration', the administrative authorities which make up the administration and administrative activities (public services, police services) are the subjects of this course.
course_learning_outcomes: Identify the subject and the scope of administrative law.
Define the basic organization of the administration.
Distinguish the administrative activity of the administration from the ones of the legislation an judiciary.
Analyse the elements of administrative actions (competence, procedure, cause, subject, purpose).
Classify administrative actions.

Law.course_description: This course is designed to give students a theoretical and practical understanding regarding the second part of the general provisions of Turkish Law of obligations. After having studied contracts as the major source of obligations in the first term, the second term will focus on the two other sources: torts and unjust enrichment. The theory of tort liability, limitation of liability, fault and strict liability as well as the different types of unjust enrichment and restitution will be dealt with. Beside these two major subjects students will be taught on different ways of discharging obligations, the effects of obligations on third parties, joint and several liability for an obligation, obligations on condition and the assignment of claims and assumption of obligations.
course_learning_outcomes: Analyze the general lines of tort law and unjust enrichment law, apply the provisions of the Turkish Code of Obligations.
Identify disputes regarding tortious and unjust enrichment and apply appropriate solutions to them derived from the Code of Obligations.
Determine the termination of debt.
Summarize the opinions in the relevant literature and will be able to benefit from them in generating justification.
Critically analyze the provisions of the Code of Obligations and discuss the need of reform.
Understand the relationship between the special and the general provisions of Turkish Code of Obligations.

Law.course_description: As a subordinated work relation, not only parties to the contract but also mandatory rules determine the content of employment relationship. This course of Employment Law focuses mainly on the relations between employers and employees in the context of the individual employment relationship. The legal structure of the employment contract, the basic principles of employment law, employee's rights and obligations and the termination of the employment contract will be examined.
course_learning_outcomes: define the basic principles and concepts in labor law
detect labor law problems in a complex event.
apply legal regulations to juristic problems.
Evaluate labor law legislation and judicial decisions from different points of view
Can establish a relationship between the regulations in other legal branches and labor law regulations and analyze the intersection points in the light of the principles of labor law.

Law.course_description: Criminal law is mainly concerned with those violations of social order which are regulated as ”crimes” by the legislative organ and their prescribed punishments. In this course, the terms of crime and punishment will be covered and the sources and general principles of criminal law and techniques of interpretation governing criminal law will be examined. After the introduction,  the general theory of crime will be analysed, whose main objective is to break down the crime into its components and analyse the theory of crime.
course_learning_outcomes: Comprehend the fundamental principles of criminal law
Detect and discern the rules concerning the application of the norms of criminal law and the elements of act and intent
Comment on and compare the legislation related to the basics of criminal liability
Determine the legal problem that lies within a case or judicial decision containing problems of criminal law
Apply the related norms of criminal law to the specific legal problem
Suggest solutions to the legal problem

Law.course_description: Property law is a component of civil law that is taught over a period of four years. In the first semester of this course, after completing a general introduction to property law, we will analyze the concept of goods, real rights and possession over property and land registry.
course_learning_outcomes:
Students who successfully complete this course, should be able
1.	To conceive the fundamental concepts related to the property law;
2.	To assess the legal issues, present in cases that fall under the scope of property law;
3.	To analyze the legal issues with the assistance of the concepts that they have learned during the class;
4.	To question the ratio legis of the provisions that regulate the property law;
5.	To assess court decisions that fall under the scope of property law by using the concepts and legal provisions that they have learned during the class.

Law.course_description: The Turkish Commercial Code assembles its general system on commercial enterprises. Commercial matters are covered by the Code, which describes as commercial any issue that is related to a commercial enterprise. The subject of the course includes commercial provisions and activities, commercial enterprises, commercial disputes and merchants and the status of the persons assisting merchants, namely commercial representatives, brokers, commercial middleman and agents.
course_learning_outcomes: Describe the concept of commercial enterprise in the context of commercial law.
Analyze the provisions of agreements regarding transfer and pledge of commercial enterprises,
Describe the concept of “merchant” which is the center of commercial law,
List the rights and obligations attributed to be a merchant,
Understand the organization of commercial enterprises and the commercial agents,
Compare and distinguish the commercial agents,
Recognize the legal protection provided by the provisions regarding trade mark and unfair competition,
Identify the convergence and divergence of commercial law with other fields of private law.

Law.course_description: The course will begin with an explanation of the general principles of company law and distinctive features of companies regulated by the Turkish Commercial Code. Following this introduction, the establishment, functioning and termination of joint stock companies will be examined in detail. A second track in the same course will cover the law of negotiable instruments.
course_learning_outcomes: Recognize the different forms of commercial companies which are regulated by the Turkish Commercial Code numbered 6102
Differentiate the ordinary partnership agreements as regulated by the Turkish Code Of Obligations numbered 6098 from other forms of commercial companies,
Describe the responsibilities and liabilities of the board of directors, general assembly and auditors of a joint stock company,
Recognize the concept of “share” and “share transfer”,
Understand shareholder rights and actions aiming to protect such rights,
Recognize grounds of dissolution and procedure of dissolution in joint stock companies,
Make comparisons between the joint stock companies and limited liability companies
Recognize the concept of “negotiable instruments”, and acquire the basic knowledge regarding the types and practice of negotiable instruments.

Law.course_description: The aim of this course is to explore substantive International Human Rights Law as well as international human rights monitoring mechanisms. In this regard, the main focus of the course will be the European Convention on Human Rights, as well as the case-law of the European Court of Human Rights. Discussion of the current national and international human rights issues will also be part of the course.
course_learning_outcomes: Use fundamental concepts and principles of international human rights law in the discussion of actual cases;
Explain the relationship between national law and international human rights law;
Apply international human rights treaty provisions to real life situations;
